loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Dolores tiene 49 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Madre soltera de dos hijos ya independientes. Es una mujer profesional, es de oficio administradora de empresas, se dedica a la gestión de cobros de impuestos. Su meta es tener las mejores condiciones en su vivienda. Solicita un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de saneamiento para su casa, con el fin de garantizarse una seguridad de vida. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a tener una vivienda digna e higiénica con una red sanitaria limpia. Su plan futuro es cancelar el crédito y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dolores is 49 and from the city of Estelí.  She is the single mother of two children, now independent.  She's a professional woman, a business administrator who works in tax collection.  Her goal is to have better living conditions in her home.  She's seeking a loan to improve her house's sanitation in order to ensure a more secure life for herself.  She feels that the loan will help her have a decent and hygienic house with a clean sanitation system.  Her plan for the future is to pay off the loan and continue improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation in her house.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for the past seven years. 

She has two buffalo from which she sells the milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra profit. 

Kouser has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Kouser is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Kouser is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Leida Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los mismo que  ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer, tiene un tanquero y una volqueta.
Doña Leida es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del su esposo, el tiene una volqueta y un tanquero y se dedica a la venta de material pétreo y agua,  como por el sector por donde ellos viven no hay agua potable  aprovecha su esposo para venderles a la personas que necesitan de este liquido vital, el también les entrega material pétreo a ciertas constructoras. Su esposo lleva dedicado a este negocio ya por más de 17  años con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y material pétreo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el banco. Su sueño es comprar otro carro nuevo.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito De Colorado [Colorado Lending Group] meets every two weeks in Colorado in the county Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handcrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is famous for its Panama hats.
It is here that Leída lives. She is 69 years old; she is married and has 4 adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a driver; he has a tanker and a dump truck.
Leída is a very good wife who is requesting the loan for her husband’s business. He has a dump truck and a tanker, and he makes his living selling stone materials and water. Since in the area where they live there is no potable water, her husband takes advantage of the opportunity to sell it to people who need this vital liquid. He also delivers stone material to several construction companies. Her husband has been doing this business for more than 17 years, with which he has supported his family.
This loan is to buy water and stone material. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito since it began, and she likes it because of the help that the bank has given them. Her dream is to buy another new car.

loans.use: to buy water and stone material.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and a mother of two children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Maricel earns a living through her retail sales of dry goods and others items. 
Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like slippers, umbrellas, and school supplies. With this she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more and augment her sales and income.

loans.use: o buy more goods to sell like slippers, umbrellas, and school supplies

loans.name: Trinatha Group

texts.en:
Sarada is the leader of a group that hails from Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 46 years. She has a small family comprised of five members, including one daughter aged about 20 years and two sons aged about 22 and 18 years. The member standing second from left with raised hand is Sarada.

Sarada has been running a grocery shop in her locality for the last five years. She looks after the shop. In the morning her husband helps to run the shop. After completion of her housework, she spends the rest of her time in the business. Her husband does seasonal business. He goes to nearby villages and purchases seasonal grains and sells them in the Muniguda market. This will be her third loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of her business. Sarada took out her first loan in 2012 with three other members from her locality.

At present her monthly income is about Rs.5,000, but that is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase  rice, oil, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions, washing powder, soap, tea, biscuits, etc. for her grocery shop. This will be the third loan cycle for the group. Sarada's future business plan is to be a wholesaler.

The other three members of the group, Dharitri, Madhabi and Krishnabeni, want a loan for their existing businesses of vegetable vending, a welding shop, and a grocery shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions, washing powder, soap, tea, biscuits, etc. for her grocery shop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a Grade III primary teacher, which is how he earns a living.

David also sells sugarcane to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn income for the better of his family, because he faces a challenge of low and delayed salaries of Primary teachers. He has hopes of becoming self employed and ensuring that all his children attain better education.

He is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a housewife and is 36 years old. She looks after her family, including five children. She is a very hardworking and punctual lady. Her husband is the sole earner of the family. He works in laundry related items preparation. He buys the necessary raw materials from the market for the preparation of laundry related items like laundry soaps, detergents, surfs, etc. He works hard and honestly for the better earning to support the family; he is providing better detergents and other necessary cleaning items to the launders as well as retailers.

Rukhsana wants to take loan so that her husband will be able to get more raw items and prepare more and reliable laundry items. In this way, Rukhsana’s husband is able to provide better financial support to the family to maintain their standard of living.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bleach and glycerin for making soap and detergent to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children between the ages of 4 and 12. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, milk, bread, washing soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a conducive environment, and his primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to add inventory of milk, bread, washing soap, and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, washing soap, and other items

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more inventory. He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy inventory items such as basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items. His business goal is to be reliable within five years. He hopes that in the future, his family will be successful. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: to buy basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 60-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his wife and five kids, two sons and three daughters, in a small simple house. He works as a teacher with a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad's daughter is a student in a local university where she studies law. She would like to finish her studies and find a job to help her family. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help his daughter to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ahmad's daughter will be able to complete her studies and take her Bachelor's degree. 

Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for his daughter for this semester.

loans.name: Sinay

texts.en:
To make a living, Sinay owns and operates a rice farm in Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. She has been in this field for nearly 14 years and uses her farming income to supplement her husband's income. He is a construction worker. This couple doesn’t have any children, but they aim to have one soon.

The challenge for Sinay’s family is that they don’t have their own motorcycle for commuting, so they have to pay a taxi for a ride. To help reduce the travelling expenses, Sinay would like to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their daily needs. Due to a lack of funds, she has applied for a loan of 1,000 USD from HKL and Kiva lenders. She expresses her thanks to all lenders for their generosity towards poor individuals like her to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a twenty nine year old hard working married man with one child aged one year. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce selling as his main source of income, though he has another side business, banana planting, where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern produce store in the years to come.

He is requesting for a loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, manure and mulch.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, manure and mulches .

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: Cándida del Rosario mayor de edad soltera, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable que ha logrado salir adelante por cuenta propia y de esa manera apoyar a su familia desde muy temprana edad, Cándida se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, zapatos, ropa nueva variada, productos plásticos, vestidos, pantalones, entre otros, negocio que tiene ya 21 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual la realiza en forma ambulante su rutina diaria empieza desde muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes fijos y eventuales, sus compras las realiza al contado en otros municipios del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales al igual que por encargos, El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros y de esta manera surtir su negocio para ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes y así también lograr cumplir con varios pedidos que ya tiene. Cándida agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas kiva les ofrece a personas bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Candida del Rosario is a single adult woman who is a native of the municipality of Chinandega, an area in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead on her own and support her family from a very early age.  Candida has a business selling general merchandise, such as: cosmetics, shoes, a variety of new clothing, plastic products, dresses, pants, and other items.  She's had this business for 21 years, and she carries out her working selling from place to place.  Her daily routine starts very early in the morning, when she goes out to offer her products to her regular and occasional customers.  She makes her purchases in cash in the various municipalities in the country.  She sells on both a cash and credit basis to all of her customers, and she also takes advance orders from them.  

Candida's goal with this loan is to invest in working capital, purchasing a variety of styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. In this way, she can stock up her business so that she will have better products for her customers and fill the orders that she already has.  Candida is grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell, including clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and plastic products

loans.name: Neemeka Group

texts.en:
Eva, who is in her early thirties, is single and has a daughter who is in school. For ten years, Eva has managed a food business (mamalishe). She works from 5:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her fourteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy cooking supplies for her restaurant. With her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she opened another mamalishe branch, bought cooking supplies and new business equipment like tables, chairs and plates to replace the old one. Her business is doing well, and she has used her business profit to buy home furniture, a cupboard, a TV and a DVD player. Eva also covered school fees and household expenses. Eva dreams of building a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Neemeka which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Playa Grande una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a ala agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a cinco horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipapas, en su carrito salchipapero, esta actividad lo realiza hace 01 año en su comunidad, son una familia unida, con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y también a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de pollos para crianza y posteriromente utilizarlo en la preparación de su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 40 and lives with his wife and children in the village of Playa Grande, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomas located five hours from the city of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the mountains of northern Peru.  The people there make their living in agriculture, business, and livestock.  

Victor makes and sells salchipapas [sausage and potatoes] from his cart.  He's been in business in his community for a year.  His is a tight-knit family.  He and his wife sell groceries in their home and they also raise cattle.

Victor has requested a loan of 4,500 soles to buy chickens to raise and later use to make his product so he can generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy chicken for his salchipapas business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle helps her husband earn a living with her swine fattening business and has been doing this for more than five years, earning well for the family.  She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to purchase feed and vitamins in order to help raise her pigs.  Michelle hopes to gain more returns for the future needs of the entire family.  She plans to improve her business by building a shelter for her pigs from her generated income.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a married woman with eight children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marilyn is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.  She has a business making bags in the Philippines.  Marilyn has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, thread, etc. for her business.  Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman, with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 37 years old and has eight children who are still in school.

Mary Ann has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Medarda works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas and charcoal.  Medarda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, rice, meat, etc. for her food vending business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, rice, meat, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Melodie

texts.en: Melodie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Melodie has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.  Melodie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna is a married woman with six children.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Miraluna is 39 years old and has four children who are still in school.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Miraluna has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Miraluna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Narcisa has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like peanuts, salt, garlic, etc. for her business.  She has been in this business for 23 years now.  In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like peanuts, salt, garlic, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has buys and sells feed in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed to sell for her business.  Nerissa has been in this business for 10 years.  She earns additional income from a general store.  Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Nillie

texts.en:
Nillie is 52 years old and married with two children.

Nillie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, juice and biscuits to sell.

Nillie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Nillie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, juice and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and buys and sells dry goods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Ofelia requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods like slippers, blouses, shorts, and t-shirts to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods like slippers, blouses, shorts, and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 47 years old and has one child.  She is married and has one child who is in school.  Paz is in the agricultural business; she fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Paz has been fattening pigs for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells soft drinks and purified drinking water in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell.  Roberta has been in this business for 4 years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store.  Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 52 years old, and her child is in school.

Rosemarie has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Semona

texts.en:
Semona is 45 years old and married, with nine children. With three children currently in school, Semona works very hard to provide for them.

Semona runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 24,000, loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Semona has been in this business for 11 years.  She sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Semona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Жумакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 1 лошадь, 14 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Jumakan is 51 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has five milk cows, one horse and 14 sheep, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Jumakan has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase cows for fattening and resale at the market for a high price. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en:
Mukadas is successful business lady. She has been busy with selling dried fruit for more than 15 years. Mukadas sells dried fruit at a local market. She buys dried fruit in bulk and retails it in a local market. She has her regular customers. 

Mukadas’s business is their main source of income. She has three children and she needs to earn more money so as to provide her children with all necessary things. Mukadas is going to increase her working capital and in this way to maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 1500 somoni to buy dried fruit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruit to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with one child aged two years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business  where he earns a living is cattle fattening. He started this business to change his standard of living and look after his family.  He has hardships of foot and mouth disease that attacks his cattle and they end up dying. However his vision is to have a milk processing machine in five years' time.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Abelino De Los Angeles

texts.es: Abelino de los Ángeles, mayor de edad casado con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, donde se produce la caña y el azúcar, Abelino es un microempresario el cual posee un negocio de distribuidor de pollo entero y en piezas, menudos entre otros, negocio el cual tiene ya varios años de experiencia, sus compras las realiza directamente a una sola marca el cual es al contado y sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, gracias al buen servicio que le brinda a sus clientes ha logrado incrementar mas su demanda, Abelino se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de variedad de pollo y menudos para ofrecer a sus clientes y asi lograr aprovechar las ventas en estas fechas.
texts.en:
Abelino de los Angeles is a married adult who has 4 grown children.  He is a native of the municipality of Chinandega, an area with a lot of commerce which is home to one of the largest sugarcane mills in the country, where they produce sugar cane and sugar.  Abelino is a small-businessman who has a business distributing chicken, including whole chickens, chicken pieces, giblets, and other parts.  He's had a number of years of experience with this business.  He makes his purchases directly from one company on a cash basis.  He sells on both a cash and credit basis to his regular and occasional customers.  

Thanks to the good service he provides his customers, he has seen rising demand for his business.  Abelino is known for being a hardworking and responsible man who has a strong desire for personal success.  His goal with this loan is to obtain working capital by purchasing a variety of chicken meat and parts to offer to his customers so that he can take advantage of the increased sales at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora owns and operates a retail business, which she has had for more than seven years.  It earns well enough that she was able to support the needs of her only son.  She also has a farm. From this investment and effort, she was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully.  She used these loans to add stock to her retail store.  Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell and was hopes to gain more profit to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 32-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her husband and two kids, a son and a daughter, in a small simple house. Her husband works as a carpenter. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Karam  is a student in a local university where she studies Finance. She would like to finish her studies and find a job so as to help her husband with part of the family expenses. 

Karam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Karam will be able to complete her studies and have her BA degree. 

Karam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol and the mother of four children. She is engaged in retail sales of slippers, shoes, and other footwear. This is the source of her income. 

Joy is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as slippers, shoes, and other footwear. In this way, she will be able to improve her inventory, thus allowing her to cater for more buyers in her store. In the future, Joy hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as slippers, shoes, and other footwear

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado ya que el conflicto de la guerra no le permitió continuar sus estudios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de tomates y pupusas, tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad que actualmente viven con ellos y están estudiando y la mamá de don José vive con ellos.


El señor se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 12 años, pues fue la necesidad la que lo llevó a aprender este trabajo, él comenta que un día se juntó con unos amigos y les contó su situación, uno de ellos que era albañil le dijo que le daría trabajo de ayudante y de esta forma comenzó a trabajar y después logró aprender a pegar ladrillo, antes se dedicaba a la agricultura. En el trabajo de la albañilería en ocasiones está cerca de su casa, pero en otras veces tiene que viajar a pie o en bus hasta 1 hora, para llegar temprano a su trabajo él se levanta a las 4:30 AM para salir a las 5:30 de su casa, trabaja una jornada de 10 horas y regresa a las 5 de la tarde, así es su rutina diaria.  


El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de una plancha industrial, una mesa con 4 sillas plásticas, una olla para cocer tamales y productos para las pupusas.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse en una carrera universitaria, ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad, espera que sus hijos lo logren. Comprar un solar para dejarles una parte a cada uno, para que construyan sus casas, luego con las ganancias espera pagar el crédito y ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
José is forty-two years old. He completed the fourth grade, but he was unable to continue studying due to the Salvadoran Civil War. He is in a common-law marriage, and his partner sells tomatoes and pupusas. They have two children, aged twelve and seventeen, who still live with them and are attending school. José's mother also lives with them.

José has been working in masonry for twelve years; it was necessity that brought him to learn this trade. He says that one day he got together with some friends and told them about his situation; one of them was a mason who told him that he would give him a job as a mason's assistant. This is how he began in the field. Afterwards, he learned how to be bricklayer. Before this, he used to work in agriculture. At times, his masonry jobs are located near his house, but other times he has to travel by foot or bus for up to an hour. In order to get to work early, he gets up at 4:30 a.m. so he can leave his house at 5:30 a.m. He works a ten-hour day and returns home at 5:00 p.m. This is his daily routine. 

This loan will be used to buy a table with four chairs, a pot for boiling tamales, a large griddle, and ingredients for making pupusas. 

His dream is to see his children graduate from college since he didn't have that opportunity. He hopes that his children can accomplish this. His other dream is buy a lot for each of his children so that they may build their own homes. Later on, he hopes to pay off his loan with his earnings and save money to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy a table with four chairs, a pot for boiling tamales, a large griddle, and ingredients for making pupusas.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 59-year-old married man. He describes himself to be flexible and creative. He operates a retail business where he sells utensils, basins and other items. His business is located in an area convenient for the business and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be security problems. 

Joseph will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to his stock of products and buy materials to build business premises. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable source of income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of products and buy materials to build business premises

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

Nilda has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 58 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.  Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent, hair conditioner, canned goods, and other groceries.  Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is widowed, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teresita is 60 years old and has one child still in school.

Teresita has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell for her business.

Zaida has been in this business for four years.  She earns other income from a general store.

Zaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is widowed, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and gear for her fishing business.

Angela has been in this business for 45 years now!

Angela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador y pujante, características que le han permitido lograr un reconocimiento en su familia y entre los vecinos del barrio donde reside. A sus 59 años de edad, es propietario de una papelería que inició hace 4 años, aprovechando la ventaja de estar ubicado al frente de una institución educativa, espacio en el que además no contaba con competencia cercana, trabaja todos los días y ofrece todo lo relacionado con la papelería, además ofrece el servicio de fotocopias, fax, escáner y vende accesorios para dama; de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo con el fin de comprar surtido al por mayor (cuadernos, lapiceros, témperas, marcadores, colores, reglas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en los primeros meses del año, debido a la temporada escolar que comienza, en la cual espera incrementar sus ingresos.
Ramón tiene como propósito, ampliar el almacén y poder ofrecer mucha más variedad de artículos, para que su negocio sea más rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a los que ama.
texts.en:
Ramon has always been a hardworking and energetic man, characteristics that have enabled him to achieve recognition in his family and among the neighbors in the area where he lives.  He is 59 years old, and is the owner of a stationery store that he started up 4 years ago, taking advantage of a location in front of an educational institution where there was no nearby competition.  He works every day, and offers all kinds of stationery items for sale.  He also provides photocopy, fax, and scanning services, and sells ladies' accessories.  In this way, he generates the resources he needs to cover the basic expenses for his family.

At this time, Ramon needs a loan to stock up his store with wholesale purchases of notebooks, pens, markers, crayons, rulers, and other items.  This way he will be sufficiently stocked up with merchandise to meet the demand that increases during the first months of the year when the school year begins, which  he hopes will enable him to increase his income.

Ramon has a goal to expand his store so that he can offer a much greater variety of items for sale.  This way his business could become more profitable and provide him with favorable financial stability, so that he can provide his loved ones with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stationery items at wholesale

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is from Pakistan. She is married and has four children. 

Irshad requested a loan for her husband. He wants to start a food stall offering barbecue to the common people of his area in the evening. For this purpose he needs chicken, grills, coal, spices and a wooden stall. In the morning he does a private job, but due to an increase in expenses he wants to start selling barbecue in the evening as well. 

Irshad is 38 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that through this stall her husband will be able to earn more income than he has previously. 

She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chicken, barbecue grills and coal to open a food stall.

loans.name: Muli

texts.en: Muli is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as humble. He operates a barber shop where he cuts hair. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a profitable place and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of hair cutting equipment. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more hair cutting equipment. His business goal is to open more businesses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have big businesses. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 100,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more hair cutting equipment.

loans.name: Enock Byororwa

texts.en:
Enock is a 43-year-old married man with four children, ages 17, 15, 12 and ten years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Enock's main business is farming produce, for which he earns a living. He started this business five years ago to change his standard of living and educate his children. He experiences the hardships of weather changes, which affect his business, and inadequate capital. However, his vision is to have a modern produce farm.
 
Enock has asked for a loan to buy more farm supplies like manure and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies like manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Siilen

texts.en:
Siilen is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in their small house in Bayanzurh district in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenechuulga, works at a local hospital as driver. Her son is serving in the military.

Siilen has been selling baby and maternity clothing from her car in front of a public maternity hospital since 2006. She has good taste in selection of baby and maternity clothing and is well known around the maternity hospital. She is planning on having a permanent workplace in the near future. She has recently changed her car into an eco-friendly electric and natural gas consuming car from her profits, and now needs an additional investment of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory in order to continue her baby and maternity clothing sales mobile business. She is hardworking, clever and a welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory in order to continue her baby and maternity clothing sales mobile business.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: La señora María Leonor tiene 56 años, habita en un barrio de mangua, se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación y su esposo es camionero, de esta forma esta familia busca la manera de salir adelante junto a sus hijos, ayudándose entre sí. Doña María  Leonor solicita crédito para invertir en el puesto de comida comprando productos de necesidad como carne pollo granos básicos verduras y frutas para los refresco, con la intensión de aumentar las ventas con mas números de platos, así mejorar su economía familiar, gracias al financiamiento que es una gran oportunidad de progreso.
texts.en: María Leonor is 56 and lives in a district of Managua.  She sells food from her house and her husband is truck driver.  They help each other out, which is how the family seeks to get their children ahead.  María Leonor is seeking a loan to invest in her food stand.  She'll buy necessities like meat, chicken, basic grains, vegetables, and fruit to have on hand.  That way she can increase sales with more dishes and improve her family's finances, thanks to the loan, which provides a great opportunity for progress.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, basic grains, vegetables and fruit to have on hand.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with one child. Her husband helps her to manage their farm to make a living. Aside from farming, her husband also worked as a chainsaw operator to augment their income. For more than five years, the family has been growing and harvesting coconuts.

Recently, she took a new microloan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer. Ruth is hopeful to gain more returns from her investments and to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of fish. Her business goal is to own a big fish business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big business and improved living standards. This is her third loan. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: add stock of fish

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a widowed woman. She has two children with ages 30 years and 32 years. She describes herself to be blessed. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy stock of  clothes. Her business goal is to have a permanent place for business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better house for her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stock of  clothes

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 62 years old and married with eleven children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns additional income from selling natural medicines.

Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is a 32-year-old, married woman with four children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Adora requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Adora has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Adora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in their ger (traditional nomadic yurt) in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Tsetsegmaa is unemployed and stays home taking care of her family. His older son works at a local company and his younger son is a senior student at a local secondary school. 

Nyamdorj has been herding livestock for years in the countryside and moved to the city with his family two years ago. He has started his transportation service business with his truck since he moved to the city. His son started working and contributes to the family income but his salary is very low and most of the family income depends on Nyamdorj's business. 

Nyamdorj is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a bigger truck to increase his family income to support his family. He is thinking of saving for the education of his younger son,  who soon will enroll in the university.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger truck to increase his family income to support his family

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a thirty eight-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. His main business is livestock production, specifically cattle-fattening, through which he earns a living. He started this business to change his standards of living and educate his children.  He gets additional income from a government salary. He faces hardships of inadequate capital to meet his high demands and competition. He has hopes of expanding his business and educating his children in higher institutions of learning. 

Peter is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Eman is a 24-year-old single young woman from Rafah city. She lives with her family  in a small simple house. Her father is a construction worker with  a low and non-stable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Eman is a student in a local university where she studies physical education. She would like to finish her studies and find a job as a teacher to help her family with part of their expenses. 

Eman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Eman will be able to do her homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: James Matthew

texts.en:
James Matthew is studying his maritime course in Misamis University, Ozamiz City. His parents run a business to earn a living. His previous loans were used to cover school expenses in order to lessen his parent's financial crisis. He is very thankful to GDMPC for helping students to pursue their studies.

He borrowed another loan from GDMPC to pay tuition fees for the second semester of this current year. He hopes he can finish his studies to have a chance to be successful and able to support his parents' needs someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the second semester of this current year

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a married man and a father of two children from San Miguel, Bohol. Nilo sells various household goods and materials to people in his area.

This is the source of his income. Nilo is asking for a loan to buy more stock of merchandise to sell like slippers, shoes, tupperware, and kitchenware. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his inventory, thus allowing him to cater to more buyers in his store. In the future, Nilo hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save extra money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of merchandise to sell like slippers, shoes, tupperware, and kitchenware.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy the needed spare parts needed for his multicab. His loan also helped in the education of his children. His income from the business is assisting with covering everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are both working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Arnel would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the multicab unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to provide for his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Arnel hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to make a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his multicab unit.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This beautiful and elegant lady’s name is Marina. She lives in Yerevan. Marina is the mother of three children:  two sons and a daughter (four years old) of marvelous beauty. As she says she is a lucky woman and the happiest mother, since she has a beloved husband and pretty children. Marina has higher education and a specialty of an economist, but now she works at the college as a supervisor. Her husband works at the driving school as a teacher. However, very suddenly for this family Marina’s husband has some problems connected with his health and he needs an urgent operation.  Marina is an optimistic person and she believes that they can overcome this hardship since together they are very strong because they love each other very much.  
Marina asks for a loan of 400.000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her husband’s surgery. She greatly thanks Kiva for help in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s surgery and she greatly thanks Kiva for help in advance.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and works hard to support her family. Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like meat, seasonings, spices, vegetables, rice, etc. for her business. Aida has been in this business for 15 years now.

Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, seasonings, spices, vegetables, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and married with four children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like toothpaste, milk, coffee, juice, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Alma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Umme Kalsoom

texts.en:
Umme Kalsoom is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Umme Kalsoom has requested a loan to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business

loans.use: To buy winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. Amparo is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Amparo requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Amparo has been in this business for two years now.

Amparo would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa appreciates her previous loan that enabled her to get profits she used to open up a fish-selling business. Apart from the retail shop, Nadzuwa prepares fried fish and sells it to her customers.

She is requesting a loan of KES 35,000 to purchase more stock of fish, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business. She appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenebileg is 48 years old and lives with her husband, in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Otgonbayar, works at an auto repair company. Her two children are married and live apart.

Erdenebileg has been working at a tailoring company since 2003, and she has a lot of experience in the tailoring business. In addition, she has tailored clothes for her children, other relatives, and friends from time to time.

She has been running her business successfully and now needs an additional investment to purchase a large amount of inventories to meet client orders on time. She has received large number of orders because of Lunar New year celebration preparation.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase inventory to meet orders on time and please her clients. She is a hardworking, helpful and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to meet orders on time and please her clients.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 20-year-old single young man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His mother is an employee in the public sector, where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Alaa is a student at a local university where he studies economics. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to do his homework and reports easily. 

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en: To make a living, Jenelie owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transport in her village. In the more than four years of running the business, she earns well and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor accessories. Aside from this, she was also engaged in food vending to earn additional income. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients in order to prepare snacks for sale. She hopes to improve her business in order to gain profits, so she can better the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in order to prepare snacks for sale.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en: Peterson is a married man. He has two children, ages two years and three years old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of fruit for resale. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will develop his piece of land. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 100,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a 36-year old married woman with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a medical clinic as her main source of income. Aside from that business, she also carries out farming in order to earn additional income. As a loving mother, she started this business to educate her children. She faces the challenges of competition and high government restrictions on private clinics, but has hopes of owning a big hospital.

She is requesting a loan to buy more drugs for her clinic to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for her clinic to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She started this business to generate more income for her family. She faces a challenge of seasonal profits since clothes are purchased seasonally. 

She has a dream of buying land to grow crops, and building a permanent house.

Agnes is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phalleap's Group

texts.en:
Phalleap is a villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is 49 years old and a married mother blessed with six children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she and her husband do paddy rice cropping as the primary source of income. Additionally, she also works at a local factory in the area to supplement her income. She has been with this business for 20 years and now it has returned her 15,800 KHR per day. 

Now, she is the group leader of two and she is in the first cycle. She and her co-borrower are requesting a loan of 177,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her household. She hopes she will have a decent latrine for her family for the sake of sanitation practice improvement.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her household

loans.name: Darajani Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 20s, is married with one child who is still small.  She has been running a business selling fabrics and sarongs door to door  for one year now.  She works from 12 noon to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy fabrics and started selling sarongs.  She is doing fine and grateful for the loan. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fabrics and sarongs to resell door to door.  She dreams of owning a shop for selling her products.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group "Darajani" which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sarongs to resell door to door.

loans.name: Dockers Group

texts.en:
Sada is a divorced woman in her late 40s. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Sada is also living with her grandchild who is in school. Currently, Sada is running a shop business selling clothes, cosmetics and other beauty products. She has been in this business for a period of four years now. She works from 8 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This is Sada's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy stocks of clothes, cosmetics and other shop products to resell. With her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Sada bought stocks of clothes and cosmetics for her shop. She used the profit to pay school fees for her grandchild, bought a TV set, a refrigerator, and a radio and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy a good stock of clothes, cosmetics and other shop products to resell at Christmas time.  She dreams of owning a big shop for her products.

Sada will share this loan with her loan group "Dockers", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and other shop products to resell

loans.name: Yunusaly

texts.en:
Yunusaly was born in 1960. He is married and has adult children. He lives with his family in a rural area.

Yunusaly grows cucumbers, onions, tomatoes, and grapes. He has been busy with this business more than 30 years.

Yunusaly has only income from growing agricultural products and it is not enough for improving his living condition. He is going to increase his working capital and maximize his profit. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors is 27 years old and married. She is a resident of Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. Sophors is engaged in farming, growing rice on small pieces of land, and also works as a paid laborer in the construction industry. She wants to provide her two children a better future, so she is working hard to provide them with basic needs and education. Through her hardships, she is able to makes approximately KHR10,000 per day.

In order to help further improve her income, Sophors is applying for a loan which enables her to buy a cow for breeding. It’s a long investment, so in years to come she hopes to produce more and earn a higher income. For her future plans, Sophors aims to make her family-owned businesses more productive and improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, desde hace más de 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de la zona, es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevo soles para la compra de polos, blusas, pantalones y otros para su negocio y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 61 years old and lives with her daughter in the Cayalti district, where its people are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  Its located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling men’s and women’s clothing for 15 years and her business is located at the area market.  She is an enterprising mother and is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to buy polo shirts, blouses, pants, and other things so she can do more business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maximiliano Antonio

texts.es:
Maximiliano tiene 30 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 
 

Maximiliano se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener dinero para dar lo mejor a los hijos, le gusta trabajar mucho y descansar.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with his wife and son in the Desvió De los Amarillo neighborhood of the Ventanas settlement in the Los Ríos province.  He is part of PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES and in Ventanas the people farm and raise livestock.

Maximiliano raises corn and raises corral animals such as chickens and pigs.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, urea, pesticides, and also balanced feed for his animals.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas. 

His dream is to have money to provide the best to his children.  He likes to work and rest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa works hard to support her family. Analisa has a live-in partner and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Analisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell.

Analisa has been in this business for five years now.

Analisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Juses

texts.en:
Juses is a married man with five adult children. He is from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for several years now. He is also engaged in a motorcycle transport business, which provides additional income.

Juses is asking for a loan to buy tires and motor oil, as well as fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Juses hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy tires and motor oil, as well as fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jocknous

texts.en:
Jocknous is a 30-year-old, single male, without children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the agriculture business for two years, plus he teaches for additional income. He is a man who loves his profession and is working hard to upgrade his studies. However, he has decided to wait to marry, first concentrating on his studies, even though he has limited capital. His vision is becoming a head master and starting up another business, so as to avoid over-relying on formal employment.

Jocknous is requesting a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase more stock of household consumables such as sweets, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household consumables such as sweets, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Don Rene es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos usados. Se siente agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que su negocio ha crecido notablemente y ha logrado incrementar sus ventas. Solicita el nuevo crédito para la compra de: Repuestos de vehículos usados. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rene is a native of Esteli. He is a merchant dedicated to selling replacement parts for used vehicles. 

He is very grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because his business has grown notably and he has been able to expand his sales.

Rene is requesting a new loan for purchasing additional replacement parts for used vehicles. He thinks the loan will be a big help in advancing his family and obtaining improved income.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for used vehicles.

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is a 24-year-old young man who lives in the village of Nagazao, Martvili district. He lives with his parents and grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. 

To take care of his family's needs, Konstantine is extensively engaged in cattle and milk cow breeding, and in the cultivation of maize, nuts, greens and cucumbers. He has three glass greenhouses where he seasonally grows greens and cucumbers. Konstantine gets income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. His parents help him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Konstantine needs a loan of 1,600 GEL to purchase cattle at the local market and sell it as  meat at nearby cities. 

He is a hard-working and motivated person, with a great desire to achieve financial stability and save money for his further development. 

Konstantine and his family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain his agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start selling the meat

loans.name: Darwin Ivan

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 32 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 9, 7, 4 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Darwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es obtener buenas ganancias y poder comprar tierras.
Le gusta ser responsable y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with his wife and children, ages 9, 7, and 4.  He lives in the Ventanas settlement in the Los Rios province.

This group is called “ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE,” and its members farm and raise livestock.  Darwin has been raising corn and rice for two years.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and sells them in the local market.

He will use the money from this loan to buy compost and fertilizer for his corn and rice crop.  The previous loan helped him increase his income and improve his family’s lifestyle.  His dream is to have better income and buy land.

He likes being responsible and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nargizi

texts.en:
Nargizi is 59 years old, and is from the Vani District. She lives with her grown daughter in her own house.

Nargizi and her daughter are unemployed, and the only source of income for the family is a small social assistance from the local government, as they live below the poverty line.  Nargizi is seeking an additional source of income, and is now requesting a loan to start a clothing sales business. 

She will purchase apparel and household items, and sell them from her house to community members and neighbors. She will offer her customers quality things at accessible prices. Nargizi will even take orders for some clothes and items, and hopes she will obtain a good income. 

She hopes her business initiative will give her a chance to earn savings for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Campos Verdes Group

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Intibucá. Hace mas de 6 años que se dedica  a la agricultura con el cultivo de papa, coliflor y brócoli. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona y obtiene sus propios ingresos.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es en forma grupal pero en lo personal solicita 12,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas y otros insumos para sus cultivos de hortalizas. Su propósito es ampliar el área de cultivo. Tiene como meta comprar un terreno para construir su casa. 
El grupo al que pertenece se llama Campos Verdes, y esta integrado por dos personas doña María y Juan, ellos se dedican a la agricultura de hortalizas, viven en la misma comunidad y el préstamo total es por 22,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y otros insumos y poderle dar un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos de papas, coliflor y brócoli.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and a single mother with a son.  She lives in the town of Intibucá and has been farming potatoes, cauliflower, and broccoli for six years.  She sells her harvest at the local market and earns her own income.  She is asking for a group loan of 12,000 Lempiras so she can buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies for her vegetable crops.  She wants to expand her farmland and her goal is to buy some land on which to build a house.

The group she is a part of is called Campos Verdes and is made up of Maria and Juan.  They raise vegetables and live in the same community.  The total amount of the loan is 22,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer, compost and other supplies so she can maintain her potato, cauliflower, and broccoli crop.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Makansa

texts.en:
40-year-old Makansa is from Liberia. She lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and her husband is a government worker. They both have four children, between the ages of 12 to 19. All four of them are presently in school and live at home. 

Makansa stopped her education at grade four. For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells cement. She started in business by selling rubber dishes and later received money from her husband to increase her inventory. She learned this way of selling from her brother. She is very happy with her business because she makes more profit every day.  

Makansa is requesting a LRD 100,000 loan to purchase more cement for her business. Her plan is to educate her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited and the lenders who support them.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for her business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 29-year-old man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He studied up to a bachelor's degree. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

He has a grocery store and it is his main source of income. He started his business three years ago.
