His business was initially started with limited capital, and didn't run well enough to make much profit. His business is located in a very strategic area. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. 

His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he earns less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 150,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his business with more grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his business with more grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband and son are green grocers by profession. They have sold fresh vegetables in a nearby town for many years. Her husband and son offer seasonal and fresh vegetables to their customers. Both have been feeding their families through the income generated from this business. 

Nowadays the needs of their families have suddenly increased and they do not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, they decided to expand their current businesses. They want to increase their stock on a daily basis so they can increase their vegetable sales.

Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband and son can buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Irshad thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Mr.Myagmar is 50 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife, Sergelen, is unemployed and stays home taking care of the family. His two children are married and live apart. 

Myagmar has graduated as driver and worked 20 years at local companies. After he retired, he purchased a second-hand Korean car to start his taxi service business. He is a well-experienced and reliable driver with a good reputation among clients. He has built his own small house for living in summer, 2013 from his business profits. 

He is now requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and install them in his car to ensure safety.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and install them in  his car to ensure safety.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari appreciates her previous loan that enabled her get profits from her fish selling business.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase more stock of fish, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

She appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y comenta que estudia esta carrera muy importante como herramienta en su trabajo de consejero espiritual para jóvenes.
De aquí en adelante su metas es levantar a jóvenes  y adolescente animándoles y motivándoles a creer que si se pueden lograr alcanzar los sueños sin importar las adversidades que hayan pasado. 
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Cristian is studying a psychology career, and he says that he is pursuing this very important degree for his work as a spiritual adviser for youth. Looking to the future, his goals are to uplift and motivate youth and adolescents to motivate them to believe that they can achieve their dreams no matter what obstacles they may face.

He is asking for this loan to be able to make his tuition payments, which will allow him to continue studying.

loans.use: to make university tuition payments

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un joven trabajador, está cursando la carrera de Análisis de Sistemas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para así poder llegar a la meta de ser un excelente profesional y tener una mejor calidad de vida gracias a su propio sacrificio, y siempre con el apoyo de su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de cuotas de su universidad, para que de esa forma este al día con ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Victor es un joven trabajador, está cursando la carrera de Análisis de Sistemas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para así poder llegar a la meta de ser un excelente profesional y tener una mejor calidad de vida gracias a su propio sacrificio, y siempre con el apoyo de su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de cuotas de su universidad, para que de esa forma este al día con ese gasto que tiene.

Victor is a young worker and is pursuing a systems analyst career with much effort and dedication. He wants to achieve his goals of being a great professional and having a better quality of life, thanks to his own sacrifice, and always with the support of his family. He is asking for this credit to be able to make his university tuition payments.

loans.use: to make university tuition payments

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil is 41 year-old, married person.He is an IDP (Internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He has worked very hard his whole life. He is a simple farmer who works tirelessly to provide for his family. Each year he sets some new goals for himself, and thanks to his perseverance he achieves them.

Habil's objective is to be a serious farmer. With this goal in mind, he has requested a loan 2,000 AZN and he is hoping to receive your help. Having had cattle at home for domestic use for many years, he knows everything there is to know about livestock and raising cattle. He has to provide the animals' feed and will raise the crop himself this year, as the cost is expensive at the bazaar in cold months. Habil awaits your support for his first loan.

loans.use: to provide animal feed and raise crops

loans.name: Juan Reyes

texts.en:
When Juan landed in the US from Puerto Rico 17 years ago, he jumped right into the towing business. After years of working for other businesses in the industry, Juan decided to grab hold of his entrepreneurial spirit and become a business owner.

Since starting El Coqui Towing, Juan’s generous spirit and knowledge of the industry have yielded a lot of success for his business.

He  envisions a big future for El Coqui Towing: He plans to have a fleet of El Coqui towing trucks on the road and build his reputation for having outstanding and reliable service. With the success of El Coqui, Juan would finally be able to  start a family and buy a home.

Unfortunately, Juan’s truck recently broke down, which has had a significant impact on his one-man business. Help Juan meet his loan goal so that he can repair his truck and continue building his business.

loans.use: To repair his tow truck.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y artículos de aseo, desde hace más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Augusto is 35 years old and lives with his wife in the Oyotún district, a farming, commercial, and livestock raising community, located two hours from Chiclayo, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He sells groceries such as milk, cooking oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks, and toiletries and has done so for more than five years.  He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise to stock his business and increase the family income.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nida works hard to support her family. In the picture, Nida and her husband are working hand-in-hand to manage their business.

Nida has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising chickens. Nida is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fabric, needles, zippers, etc. for her tailoring business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through a past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fabric, needles, zippers, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
For the last three years, Esther has been in the business of selling timber and the business has improved greatly, with a good income.

She has applied for her fourth loan of KES. 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to boost her timber selling business by buying more timber.

Her monthly income at present is about KES. 30,000; she plans to use her profits to pay her loan, educate her children, and boost her business.

She hopes that in the future she will have a fulfilled life.

loans.use: To boost her timber selling business by buying more timber.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as laundry soap, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Lorlyn has been in this business for four years. Lorlyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lorlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items such as laundry soap, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Charish is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Charish requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Charish has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ruth requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like lotion, undergarments, lipsticks, perfumes, etc. to sell.  In the future, she  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy Avon products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 62 years old and is a widow with three children. 

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.   She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lourdes has been farming sugarcane for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en:
Rim is a resident from the Kandal Stoeng distict of Kandal province. He is 45 years old and a father of four dependent children, two of whom are in school while the remaining two are too young for schooling. 

To support the family, he works as a construction worker for a fee, and does rice farming as the main source of income. Having been with the current business for four years, he is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day. 

Besides focusing on his income generating activities, he also wants to pay attention to the sanitation practices in his household. However, he does not have any decent latrine yet, which is quite challenging for him. To overcome this challenge, he formed a group of two to get a first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He and his co-borrower are applying for the same loan amount of 177,000 KHR each. 

As a leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for his household. 

He hopes his family will has good health with better living conditions.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for his household

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia works hard to support her family. Anatolia is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She  has been in this business for 30 years now.

Anatolia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, candies, beers, etc. to sell.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 62 years old and married.  Elsa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like cooking oil, juice, sugar, bath soap, noodles, etc. to sell.  Elsa has been in this business for 33 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, juice, sugar, bath soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 59 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 8 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle works hard to support her family. Mitchelle is married and has a business selling religious items in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Mitchelle requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more religious items to sell.   She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy religious items to sell

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old Aggrey who lives in Kitale and is involved in farming.  Kitale is an area known for good poultry breeding.  Aggrey has practiced farming for 6 years.  He produces and sells milk, eggs, and a bit of maize.  In farming, he loves horticulture and poultry, but his major challenge is pests and diseases affecting his poultry.

Aggrey chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help finance farmers with loans to improve on their farming activities.  Juhudi also encourages farmers to save for their future farming activities and businesses. This loan will help him generate more income which will help him in his future endeavours.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is 29 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He is an employee in the government sector, getting a low salary which is barely enough to cover his family's needs. He requested a loan to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports.  This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy a laptop

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a farmer living in Kitale with her 3 children, all of whom are of school-going age.  She has been practicing farming for 10 years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and tea.  In farming, she enjoys horticultural and poultry farming, but her fear is that these two areas are so prone to pests and diseases.

Rachel chose Juhudi Kilimo because she has heard testimonies of how farmers have acquired assets for their farming projects and ways in which they can generate more income.  She said that this loan will help her generate more income which will enable her educate her children and give them a better life.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a married woman and the mother of three children; her eldest is 27, and the youngest is 18. Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol.
 
Teodula is a farmer and has been in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Teodula is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm.

In the future, Teodula hope to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
To make a living, Albino  owns and operates a business providing transportation services in his village, and he earns well from this. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used to improve the business. 

To increase his income, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair the existing vehicle and buy new accessories.  

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.  

Albino wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to repair the existing vehicle and buy new accessories.

loans.name: Lufrida

texts.en:
Lufrida is a 32-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be loyal. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair treatment and beauty services. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of beauty products. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair dryer and beauty products. 

Her business goal is to have a big salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be comfortable in life. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 50-year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in poultry, and she rears chicken and cows as her side income. She started this business to generate more income to sustain her family. Her main challenges are poultry diseases that attack her chickens and they end up dying, and inadequate capital to buy equipment. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy more chicks to sell.

She has hopes that in future she will have an expanded farm.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has three children. She operates a fishing business in their community to make a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns well from this. She had joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy new fishing nets. She was determined to gain more income to provide for the needs of her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Abelina De Jesús

texts.es:
Abelina de 60 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 4° grado, esta acompañada y su compañero de vida, tiene un negocio de vender leña, solo viven con una hija de 18 años y una nieta, las cuales estudian en bachillerato.

 Abelina posee una tortilleria y una pupuseria, desde hace 14 años, aprendió el oficio, ya que por su bajo nivel de estudio, se le hacia muy difícil encontrar un empleo formal, el negocio lo hace en su casa, para  ello inicia la jornada de trabajo a las 10:00 de la mañana, hasta las 8 :00 de la noche, también le ayuda su hija y su nieta.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, para comprar 20 sacos de maíz, gas y otros insumos para su negocio, ya que actualmente el maíz esta a bajo precio, lo que ayudara a ahorrarse un dinerito y también a proveerse de maíz, para tener siempre las tortillas para sus clientes.

Abelina, esta planificando crecer con su negocio, administrándolo de la mejor manera y ahorrar, para mejorar su casa, ya que esta bastante deteriorada, también ayudar a su hija a que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Abelina is 60 years of age and only studied to the 4th grade. She is married and her life companion has a  business selling firewood. They live with their 18-year-old daughter and a grand-daughter, both of whom are attending school.

 Abelina has operated her shop selling tortillas and typical Salvadoran snacks for the last 14 years. She learned the business because with her low level of studies, it was hard to find formal employment. Abelina's business operates from her house. Her work day extends from 10:00 am until 8:00 at night. Her daughter and grand-daughter assist her.

The loan, which Abelina is soliciting through CREDICAMPO, is for purchasing 20 sacks of corn, plus bottled gas and other inputs for her business. At present, corn is selling at a lower price, which will help her to save a little money. The loan will supply Abelina with corn so that she will always have tortillas for her customers.

Abelina plans to expand her business, administering it in a better manner and to save, so that she can improve her house, which is seriously deteriorated. Also, she wants to help her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of corn, bottled gas, and other inputs for her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married and has five schoolgoing children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the last five years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Abshir Abdirhaman

texts.en:
Abshir Abdirhaman is 23 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of Information Technology. 

Being without a laptop is his major problem. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, download books and to make class presentations. 

He requested a laptop from Kaaba Microfinance Institution. Kaaba will provide him a laptop as a loan, and he will pay monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
67-year-old Crispina lives in Corella, Bohol. For seven years now she has raised hogs for a living. With her business, Crispina would not have to rely on her three grown children for her needs.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and supplements. The loan will enhance her business improvements and provide a better return on her investment.

In the future, she would like to have a bigger piggery so she can maximize her business and have better profits.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with four sons. Eyad works as an employee in the public sector with a low income that barely cover the family's needs. He also sells fruits and vegetables in the local market after work. This helps him cover part of the family expenses. Eyad would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money. 

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some seasonal fruits and vegetables from the farmers and resell them in the local market. By taking this loan, Eyad's income will be increased and the family's living conditions will improve.
 
Eyad appears in the photo while he is working

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en: Rowaida is a 30-year-old married lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her retired husband and four sons. She has been running her mini market for four years to support her husband in improving their living conditions. She recently has purchased new products for her mini market, but she faced a lack of space to introduce them so she needs to add racks. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more racks where she can introduce her products

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop  business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jose Simon

texts.es: El señor José, vive en una comunidad alejada, es soltero y no tiene dependientes. Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en su pequeña parcela produciendo frejol y cebolla, lamentablemente en la anterior cosecha el rendimiento de sus cultivos se vio afectado por problemas climáticos, como los ingresos que obtuvo no fueron suficientes, para cubrir sus gastos también trabaja de jornalero, actualmente está solicitando un crédito para comprar semilla de tomate, semilla de frejol, abono orgánico, abono químico y agroquímicos, de esta manera lograra mejorar su  producción y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose lives in a remote town, and is single with no children. He works in agriculture on his small parcel of land producing beans and onions. Unfortunately, during his previous harvest, the outcome of his crops were affected by climatic problems, and his earnings from that season were not enough to cover his costs. He also works as a laborer. Currently, he is asking for this loan to buy tomato seeds, bean seeds, fertilizer, and agro-chemicals in order to improve crop production and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, bean seeds, fertilizer, and agro-chemicals

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo, vive en una comunidad alejada, tiene dos hijos dependientes, y se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en unas pequeñas parcelas que con mucho sacrificio y trabajo pudo adquirir, en la anterior cosecha hubo un desastre natural y sus cultivos bajaron su rendimiento, como esto afecto sus ingresos tuvo que trabajar de jornalero  para mantener a toda su familia. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar semilla de  tomate, semilla de frejol y abono orgánico, de esta forma mejorara la calidad y el rendimiento de sus cultivos y a la vez obtendrá más ingresos para otorgarles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Leonardo lives in a faraway Community, has two dependents and is a farmer on some small parcels that he was able to acquire with lots of work and great sacrifice.  There was a natural disaster during the last harvest and he had a lower production.  This affected his income and he had to work as a field hand to be able to support his family.  Now he is asking for a loan to buy tomato and bean seeds and compost.  In this way he will be able to improve his production and income so he can provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a business-minded woman who, at the age of 68 years old, has multiple business. She is engaged in making tabliya (cacao chocolate) and is a resident of Dauis, Bohol.

She has been engaged in tablea making (cacao chocolate) and making poltroon (a powdered milk candy made of flour, sugar, butter and powdered milk) for several years now. This is her source of income.

Pelagia is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine and eggs. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine and eggs

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Genesa has been in this business for one year. Genesa earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Genesa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Alifer

texts.en:
Maria Alifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Maria Alifer has been in this business for one year and earns more income from her general store.

Maria Alifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a 55-year-old single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Rizalina requested a 6000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more firewood to sell.

Rizalina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 53 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region. Aremn lives with his wife, two daughters, and retired mother. His elder daughter works at the economical college as a lecturer and his younger daughter is still a student. 

For ten years, Armen has been running his business of candy and eggs distribution to over 200 shops of his city, using his own car. He buys candy from Yerevan wholesale markets and eggs from poultry farms. With the coming of Christmas and New Year holidays, Armen has more orders from shops and he awaits a decent income at the end of this year. 

He asks for a loan of AMD 1,000,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a lot of candies and eggs, to manage to meet all his orders. He also plans to start working, not only with city shops, but also with nearby village shops, as well.

loans.use: to buy a lot of candies and eggs, to manage to meet all his orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Nisel

texts.en: Nisel is married with three children. She helps her husband in their farm, growing and harvesting rice to make a living. She has been doing this for many years and earning well for the family. She had joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional fertilizer. The couple was determined enough to gain more returns from their investment and the efforts dedicated to their farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Because Hamda is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Hamda was born in 1976. She is married and has four sons and daughters. She started her project of home products sales three years ago trying to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of home products and to add children's toys to her sales in order to raise her profit. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more home products for her business

loans.name: Salvador Allende Group

texts.es: Carola quien aparece de las terceras de izquierda a derecha mirando hacia la izquierda, pertenece al Banco Comunal Salvador Allende ubicado en Castro. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tiene diversos negocios tales como venta de ropa nueva y venta de ropa por catalogo, venta particular de pan amasado, venta ambulante, librería y bazar. Carola tiene un negocio de abarrotes el cual lo comenzó hace 3 años y medio cuando le entregaron su casa junto a su marido se le ocurrió para generar más ingresos colocar un negocio y fue como de a poco lo ha ido construyendo. Sus desafíos son implementar su negocio con más artículos para cumpleaños, librería y venta de juguetes también, su idea es que cuando le vayan a comprar ella tenga todo lo que los clientes necesiten. El dinero que está solicitando lo ocupará para la compra de helados y paquetería. Sabe que le ira muy bien ya que tiene una gran clientela que está ansiosa de que pronto venda helados, y cuenta que lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder compartir con sus vecinas y así hacen sus reuniones dentro de su mismo sector lo que ayuda también a que no tenga que cerrar tanto tiempo sus negocio.
texts.en: Carola, who is third from the left, looking to the left, belongs to the Communal Bank Salvador Allende, which is located in Castro. The members of this Communal Bank have diverse businesses such as selling new clothes, selling clothes in catalogs, direct sale of homemade bread, vending, bookstores, and bazaars. Carola has a grocery store which she started three and a half years ago when she and her husband moved into their house, and her husband had the idea to have a business. They have been building the store little by little. They would like to have more birthday items, books, and toys in their store. She wants customers to be able to purchase anything they need in the store. The money requested will be used for the purchase of ice cream and shipping supplies. She knows that she will do very well since she has a large client base that is eager for the store to sell ice cream. She says that what she has enjoyed the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the ability to share with her neighbors and the capability to have meetings in their own sector, which is helpful because they do not have to close their businesses for as much time.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and shipping supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Gurami

texts.en:
Gurami, a 44-year-old man, is an experienced farmer from the village of Nakharebao in the Martvili district. He lives with his mother. 

To take care of his family's everyday needs, Gurami raises cows and grows nuts, maizes, and persimmons. The cheese, maize, and dried fruit of persimmons are sold at the local market. This is the main source of the family's income. This business is seasonal, and Gurami wants to start another business activity that will provide an additional source of income. 

Gurami applied for a loan through LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program which is a joint initiative with Kiva that assists rural people with starting or re-starting businesses. A loan of 5800 GEL will enable Gurami to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them intercity. 

Gurami is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to make his and his mother's life better. He will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him maintain his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 20-year-old farmer living in Kitale with her 2 children. She has practiced farming for 2 years where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and bananas. She loves dairy farming as it generates more income for her, but her biggest challenge is livestock diseases.

Joan chose Juhudi Kilimo because they cater to the well being of low-income earners like her, and help improve their livelihoods by offering asset financing to them at low interest rates. This loan will generate more income for her and thus she will be able to educate her children better.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is from the village of Jocho. He is 29 years old, married, with one child. His mother and married brother and his family live with Mirian as well. 

Mirian runs small-scale agricultural land and has a citrus garden. He sells citrus in the wintertime and earns seasonal income. The family also has one milk cow and sells cheese at the local market. 

Mirian managed to save and has recently bought an apartment in the neighboring town. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase furniture and furnish the flat comfortably. Mirian plans to rent it out at a good price and get a monthly income. This initiative will increase his family's funds and Mirian will be able to improve the standard of living for his family members. He hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase furniture  to furnish his apartment and rent it out

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is an established farmer, living in Kitale with her four children. She has been doing farming for the past 15 years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and maize. In farming, she loves poultry and dairy farming, but her greatest challenge is eradicating livestock diseases. Judith chose Juhudi Kilimo, so that they can finance her, to improve her farming activities.

This loan will generate more income to Judith, which she will use to better educate her children and also improve her family's living standards. Judith appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for helping low-income farmers to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Greis

texts.en: Greis was born in 1978. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her husband and her two sons. Greis has been trying her best to support her husband financially by selling accessories for the past year. She started with a small amount of accessories and found it profitable. Now she wants to purchase a larger quantity of accessories and to add perfumes sales to raise her income. This will help her cover the needs of her sons. She doesn't have enough money to purchase more accessories and perfumes. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina was born in 1982. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband, who is in the military, and her four daughters. She started her project of clothes sales one year ago in order to support her husband in covering their daughters’ needs. Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of clothes and to add new products to her sales in order to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 27-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small business that sells ladies clothing. 

Abida, along with her husband, purchased clothing from the market at a low price to sell it at a higher price. The ladies of the town like her clothing and dress selection and are demanding more variety because it is marriage season. Abida helps ladies choose which clothing one should wear according to the occasion.  

Abida's husband buys her clothing for resale with his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only to savings. She requested a loan so that she could buy a variety of winter clothing to fulfill the current demand.

Abida wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams to provide better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbayar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four sons in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Umnugovi province, Mongolia. His wife Tsengunjav is a teacher at a local school. His older three sons attend university, public school, and kindergarten respectively and his youngest son is one year old and stays home with his grandmother during the daytime.
 
He has been working at a local government office since he graduated from university in 2000. He quit his job last year and has just started his photography and printing service business in a rental place. He was very interested in photography and office supplies as a kid. He is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory to start his business. He is a hardworking and clever man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory to start his business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben operates a business providing transportation in the community in order to make a living. With more than a year in the business, he is doing well for his family. Ruben joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan to cover repairs and maintenance costs. In the future, Ruben wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family.

loans.use: to cover repairs and maintenance costs

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas es un joven trabajador, casado, padre de dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad que estudian, su profesión es carpintero labor que ejerce en un mercado capitalino,  con este negocio Douglas  paga sus gastos y mantiene a su familia. Este crédito que solicita es para invertir en madera, plywod, barniz, pintura y accesorio para realizar encargos de sus clientes y tener mayor producción de muebles variados  para poder vender, y que le permitan garantizar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Douglas is a young worker, he is married, and the father of two children, aged 14 and 13 who are in school. He works as a carpenter in a capital market. Douglas pays his bills and supports his family with his business. The loan requested will be used to invest in wood, plywood, varnish, paint, and accessories to fulfill his clients' orders and produce a larger variety of furniture to sell, and this will guarantee that he has an income.

loans.use: to purchase wood, plywood, varnish, paint, and accessories.

loans.name: Lenin Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Lenin, trabaja mucho para poder sustentar a su familia, casado para de un hijo, en edad escolar, labora para una fabrica de productos de Aluminio, sus espasa lo apoyo con las tareas del hogar ademas trabaja como docente para un colegio publico, el desea culminar su mayor sueño, construir su casa, se le hace muy complicada recaudar el dinero de una sola vez por los diferentes gastos que con frecuencia se presentan, el credito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construccion, realizara mejoras en las paredes, y cambios en la cocina, los materiales a comprar son, Cemento, Arena, Ceramica, etc. Agradece el apoyo que se  le ha brindado.
texts.en: Lenin works a lot in order to support his family. He is married and has one school-age child. He works for a factory that makes aluminum products and his wife helps him with house chores. She also works as a teacher for a public school. He wishes to achieve his greatest dream, which is to finish building his house. It is very hard for him to get all the money together at once because of different expenses that often arise. He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials. He will improve the walls and make changes to the kitchen. The materials he will buy are cement, sand, ceramic, etc. He is grateful for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Luvuno sells various household items, such as cutlery, plates, cups, basins, and carpets among others.

With the 60,000 KES she wants to purchase more stock of household items such as kitchen utensils, and carpets for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household items such as kitchen utensils, and carpets for her business.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten was born in 1980. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Dair Alla with her husband, who is in the military, and her three sons. She started her project of clothing sales one year ago, trying to support her husband in covering their daughters’ needs. Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of clothing, and add new products to her sales in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: Sobirjon is a hard-working man from a rural area. He is 33 years old. Sobirjon is married, and has two children. His children are non-adults. Sobirjon is a builder. He has seasonal work. In the winter season he doesn't have a job. Sobirjon is the main breadwinner of his family. His family is big. He lives with his parents, brother, sister, wife, and two children. His wife is a housewife. She has been busy with bringing up her children. Sobirjon must buy coal for the winter season, but he hasn't got money. The weather is so cold and he must keep a warm temperature in his house because his children are small. He is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy coal. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy coal for the winter season.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
To make a living, Renie owns and operates a service-based business, providing motor transportation in his community. He has done this work for more than three years. Renie earns a better income, and he has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for motorcycle repair and tires.

To continue his service, he took a new loan recently. He will use this loan for license renewal costs. He always finds ways to augment his family's living situation.

loans.use: to cover his license renewal costs

loans.name: Carlos Gerald

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Gerald habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde nació y fue criado solo con el esfuerzo de su madre donde le agradece por haberle dado la vida, por haberse preparado como profesor de Matemática donde hoy es un hombre de bien, casado, con un hijo, que gracias a su profesión y la ayuda de los préstamos de los inversionistas de Kiva tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida poco a poco.
Se siente muy orgulloso de ser Sauceño y de ejercer esta profesión porque ha enseñado a muchos jóvenes a sumar y restar algo que les sirve en el futuro.
En la actualidad su esposa estudia la carrera de Farmacia y por tal motivo Carlos Gerald está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen para pagar el arancel de varios meses de la universidad y esto no sea un obstáculo para que ella culmine su carrera y sea una profesional.
Como todo hombre cristiano tiene la fe en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón lo apoyen para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Carlos Gerald lives in the city of El Sauce, where he was born and raised by his mother, whom he appreciates for having given him life.  He became a math teacher and now is a man of means, is married, and has a son.  Thanks to his profession and help from the Kiva lenders he has a home of his own and he has been improving his living conditions little by little.

He is very proud to be “Saucean” and to do the work he does because he has taught many young people to add and subtract; something that will help them in the future.

His wife is studying for a Pharmacy career so Carlos Gerald is asking for a loan from the Kiva lenders through Ceprodel so that he can pay for several months of university tuition so that there will be no obstacles for her completing her studies and becoming a professional.  

Like any Christian man, he trusts in God that people with good hearts will support him in completing his objective.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene 01 hijo que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en el sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, frescos y granos básicos.
Doña Saturnina  es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir  adelante junto con su  familia está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, maíz,  frescos, azúcar, etc. y un molino de moler maíz. Con el  apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y también sus ingresos.
Doña Saturnina  está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma es un buen cliente con muchas ganas de mejorar su manera de vivir.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She has one dependent child. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. She owns her home and has been working selling groceries, soft drinks, and basic grains for ten years. 

Saturnina  is an enterprising woman who is very driven to get ahead with her family. She is requesting a new loan to buy rice, beans, corn, soft drinks, sugar, etc. and a corn grinder. With the support from this loan, she plans to improve her business as well as her income.

Saturnina is very happy to continue working with Prisma. She is a good client and she is very driven to improve her way of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, soft drinks, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kiutza Karina

texts.es: Kiutza es una joven de 24 años de edad, soltera sin hijos a cargo. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida rápida. Negocio que inicio hace pocos años vendiendo sandwish; con el motivo de independizarse; luego, poco a poco fue incrementando la demanda de sus clientes, por ello decide alquilar un local.  Actualmente cuenta con un amplio negocio y con mucha demanda de clientes. Su meta es vender otro tipo de comida conocida en la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina freidora, para cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes y ofrecer diferentes comidas. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que incrementara sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es tener su propio local.
texts.en: Kiutza is a young woman who is 24 years old. She is single and does not have any children. She is from the city of Esteli. She is in the service industry. She works selling fast food. She started the business a few years ago selling sandwiches, with the goal of becoming independent. Later, little by little her clients' demands grew, so she decided to rent a space. Her goal is to sell a different type of food that is well-known in the city. She asks for this loan so she can purchase a kitchen fryer to fulfill her customers' orders and offer different foods. She thinks that the loan will be very helpful since it will increase her sales and increase her profits. Her plan for the future is to have her own property.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen fryer.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in the village of Sevkar in Tavush region. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and a son. Two of her daughters and her son are already married. Hamik’s son and her daughter-in-law are still students. Hasmik is engaged in farming and agriculture since she got married, before she used to do the work with her husband, but now she perfectly does it all alone since he is in the Russian Federation and from there he partially provides for his family.

On her plot of land, Hasmik cultivates different fruits and sells them through re-sellers. In her farm she has cows, piglets, a horse and chickens. She says that her farm income helps her to pay for her son’s and his wife’s education and takes care of her family’s needs.  

She asks for a loan of 650.000 Armenian drams in order to buy five piglets and fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and fodder for them.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 38-years-old and she lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has two nice daughters. Her elder daughter is a student and her second daughter still studies at the college. Marine’s husband, like many other men in their village because he was unemployed and had too little income from farming, has gone to the Russian Federation in order to earn more money for his family by working there. 

For her part, Marine does everything to help her husband by perfectly running the farming and agricultural activities. She has three cows, two calves, two heifers, nine sheep and forty chickens. The meat, milk and eggs she sometimes sells to re-sellers from her house and sometimes at the wholesale market of the city of Sevan. 

Marine wants to increase the number of her farm cattle and she is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams n order to buy cattle and also fodder them.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and fodder for them.

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora lives in the village of Gandzaqar in Tavush region. He has large nice family consisting of five members.  He and his wife have three children, who are all school-aged. Zhora, since he was very young, has been a farmer and farming is the only source of income for his family. In his farm he has two cows, two calves, two heifers, two bulls and chickens. He sells a lot of meat to butchers. He mainly cultivates potatoes and the main part of it they use for their own. 

He is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy four piglets and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and animal fodder.

loans.name: Luz Aleida

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 45 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Trabajó como empleada en una tienda de venta de libros y música allí, alternó su empleo con la venta de obleas y solteritas, actividad que realizaba en el mismo almacén donde trabajaba gracias a que su jefe le permitió disponer de un pequeño espacio para realizar esta actividad, así logró generar los recursos para solventar los gastos familiares durante los últimos 16 años que realizó esta actividad. Actualmente trabaja en otro almacén como vendedora de mostrador de lunes a sábado, de 10:00 am a 7:00 pm y desea reactivar su negocio de venta de dulces para seguir generando mejores ingresos.
Por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito para comprar utensilios de cocina y surtido al por mayor (galletas de oblea y solteritas, crema dulce, arequipe, queso, leche condensada, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad para comenzar a producir ingresos adicionales.
Luz tiene como objetivo principal fortalecer su negocio para que se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos y así poder independizarse completamente y poder disfrutar más tiempo con su hijo, por quien lucha constantemente para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and has one child. She has been head of household since she separated from her husband. She used to work for a book and record store. She would also sell wafer cookies and solterita biscuits, a business she carried out at the store thanks to her boss, who allowed her to have a small area in order for her to do business. This allowed her to cover her family expenses for the last sixteen years that she had that job. She currently works at a different store at the counter Monday through Saturday from 10:00 am to 7:00 pm and wants to restart her business selling sweets in order to keep generating better income.

That is why she decided to request this loan, so that she can buy kitchen utensils and wholesale goods like wafer cookies and solterita biscuits, caramel, sweet cream, cheese, condensed milk, and other products. This will allow her to start supplementing her income.

Luz's main goal is to strengthen her business so that it becomes her main source of income and she can become completely independent and spend more time with her son. She fights for him constantly in order to give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and stock up on wholesale items like wafer cookies and solterita biscuits, caramel, sweet cream, cheese, condensed milk, and other products.

loans.name: Zonoub

texts.en: Because Zonoub is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Zonoub was born in 1981. She lives with her husband in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. It has been one year since she started her project of perfume sales, trying to support her husband in improving their living conditions. Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of perfumes, and to add new products to her sales, in order to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Mocache  y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para fomentar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es superar la pobreza del hogar.
Le gusta ser responsable y viajar.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and their two children in the Mocache Canton in Los Ríos Province. The communal bank to which she belongs is called Juntos Triunfaremos [Together, we will triumph] which is located in Jhon F. Kennedy 2 Precinct in the Mocache Canton, close to Ventanas. The members of this bank work in agriculture and livestock farming. 

María has been earning a living by growing corn and rice for a few years now. She buys items she needs in Mocache and sells her products in the same area. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy manure and fertilizer for corn and rice crops. The loan will help her improve her family's financial situation. Her dream is to break out of the poverty in the area. She is responsible and likes to travel.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to grown corn.

loans.name: Emilene

texts.en:
Emilene is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 24, and 26. Her husband also works as a farmer.
Emilene works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm.  She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm, and to pay the school fees of her children. Emilene believes that through this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm, and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Nakuru. She operates a quarry, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of  20,000 KES. 

Lydia is requesting her second loan from VisionFund Kenya for 27,000 KES, which she will use to to purchase more quarrying equipment and to employ more staff.  She will use the income to pay her loan, educate her children, and boost her business. In future, she hopes to buy a plot and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more quarrying equipment and to employ more staff

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is married with two children. She manages her own farm while her husband works abroad to make a living. After two years of growing and harvesting bananas, she earns well and is able to expand the farm. She joined GDMPC and is borrowing a new loan to buy fertilizer and cover house repair costs. She wants to improve her family's quality of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover house repair costs

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny, aged 42, is a villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province. He is married with three dependent children; they are still in school. To make a living, he has been in the pork-selling business for eleven years. He and his group member have been with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) before. He has been with Vision  Fund (Kiva’s partner) for the last three times, while his group member has been with them four times. They are successful with repayment. For the past loan, it has helped his family’s situation better, and he is able to keep his children in school. Now, he and his group member are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to expand his business on a larger scale. He hopes his family’s income will increase, and he can keep his children in school.

loans.use: to expand his business on a larger scale.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: “SAN MARTIN”  es uno de los grupos puntuales en sus cuotas . Los socios del mencionado grupo se sienten muy satisfechos por  encontrarse pasando el 06 ciclo. Lucila tiene 55 años es soltera con 02 hijos independientes. Hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos. Y al a vez trabaja como cocinera en un restauran de su localidad. Lucila tiene como proyecto aperturar su bodega en su vivienda para obtener mejores ingresos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes colonias y juegos de joyas que estén en oferta para expenderlos a un precio elevado para obtener mejores ganancias.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Lucila es la segunda del lado derecho. En la parte superior derecha se encuentra Percy que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
San Martin is one of the groups that pays their installments on time. The members of this group feel very satisfied to be in their sixth cycle. 

Lucila is 55 years old. She is single and has two adult children. She has been selling beauty products by catalog for many years and she also works as a cook in a local restaurant. Lucila's project is to open a store in her home in order to obtain better income. She will invest this loan in purchasing fragrances and jewelry sets that are on sale in order to sell them at a higher price and obtain a higher profit. 

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan. Lucila is the second person from the right. The top portion shows Percy, who wasn't able to be present for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy fragrances and jewelry sets.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four grown children. She toils the land and grows rice. To help augment her income, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells various items ranging from cooking oil, noodles, and canned goods to toiletries. Her farming business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer to have a bountiful harvest.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en: Venerando is a married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has seven children.  He has been engaged in the fishing business for 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Venerando is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, lead weights, and floaters. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with three children. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income from selling piped water. 

She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to sell at wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for nine years. He earns well from this to provide for his family. He successfully repaid his previous loan used for spare parts. He borrowed a new loan to buy a new set of tires to replace the old ones. In the future, Joel hopes to have another motorcycle to increase earnings for his family's needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Jhon Wilder

texts.es:
Jhon Wilder tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el caserío las Delicias, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de animales de corral patos, pollos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, también ofrece servicios de jornalería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon Wilder is 44 years old. He lives together with his wife and children in the settlement of Las Delicias, a rural zone in the district of Oyotún. The inhabitants dedicate themselves to farming, ranching and commerce, and it is located two hours from the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with his wife, he works selling small farm animals such as ducks and chickens. His business is located at his home. He also offers his services as a day laborer. He has requested a loan of 1,500 Peruvian new soles to buy pigs and balanced feed for them. In this way he will generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and balanced feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
María Lorena tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil Casada vive con el esposo  y con su hijo de 2 años, Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

María Lorena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es mejorar en los negocios.
Le gusta trabajar y  pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
María Lorena is 23 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and their 2 year old son in the Mocache Canton in Los Ríos province.

The communal bank to which she belongs is called Juntos Triunfaremos [Together, we will triumph] which is located in the Jhon F. Kennedy 2 Precinct in Mocache canton, close to Ventanas. The members of this bank work in agriculture and livestock farming. 

María Lorena has been earning a living by growing corn and rice for a few years now. She buys the items she needs in Ventanas at "Agroquímica Briones" and sells her products in a market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy farming supplies that she needs to grow corn and rice. The loan will allow her to invest, and increase income for her family. 

Her dream is to improve her business. She likes to work and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy the supplies needed to grow corn.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha, 31, is a borrower from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province and a mother of three children. All of them still rely on her as two of them are in school and one is very too young. To earn a living she does rice cropping as the main source of income, with support from her husband. Engaging in the current business for the past four years, she is able to earn up to 18,500 KHR per day. 

Sopha is a leader of a group with two borrowers in their first cycle loan requesting 177,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sopha will use her loan to build a latrine for her family. She hopes her family will own a decent latrine to improve the hygienic practices in her household.

loans.use: To build a latrine for her family.

loans.name: Shatweh

texts.en: Shatweh was born in 1965. She is a married lady living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her husband and four children. Her husband currently works as a truck driver. Shatweh has been selling goats and their products for two years. She started her business by selling a small quantity of goats. Now she is planning to buy cement and blocks to build a stockyard for the goats. She is planning to buy a larger quantity of goats to raise her productivity and income in order to support her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats for her business

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Feda was born in 1963. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her retired husband and four children. 

Feda has been trying her best to support her husband financially by running her mini-market, which she started running one year ago. She started her project by selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. 

Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of food products in order to raise her sales, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food products for her business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 34 years old  and married with 5 children ages 13, 9, 6, 4 and 2. She also lives with a house helper. Four of the children attend school and Justine is responsible for paying their school tuition and other fees.
Justine is a nurse who operates a drug shop in a trading center in the Kibaale district, working six days a week. She started this business because she wanted a source of income to sustain her family. Apart from the business she also does farming to supplement her incomes.
Justine has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to boost her drug shop business. She will be able to stock the drugs demanded by her customers.She describes herself as a hard-working and shrewd person in business.

loans.use: To buy drugs to sell in the pharmacy

loans.name: Humberto Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Humberto, soltero trabaja para una empresa Privada, el vive con su mama, quien apoya economicamente, dentro de la vivienda el tiene un cuarto el cual desea realizarle algunas modificaciones ya que esta no presenta la condiciones necesarias, el credito lo solicita para comprar materiales de cosntruccion como Bloques, cemento, Arena, Hierro. don Humberto se encuantra agradecio por el apoyo recibido de parte de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Humberto is a single man who works for a private business and lives with his mother. He supports her financially and would like to do some renovations in one of the rooms in their home. The reason is that the room is in inadequate condition and he's requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, and iron. Humberto is grateful for the support being given by Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Oscar Elvin

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Elvin de 34  años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos que dependen de él,  vive  en una comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 09  años  a la venta de carne de cerdo, pescado y cría y venta de ganado.
Don Oscar Elvin sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de la colonia donde él vive, su venta es de forma ambulante el sale en su bicicleta todo los días por las mañanas a vender en los barrios y colonias el producto, también se dedica a la compra venta de terneros vacas paridas.
Don Oscar Elvin está solicitando el préstamo para comprarse una vaca ya que  le venden una muy buena vaca de lechera, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma, en esta ocasión solicita su préstamo número diez, es un buen cliente y con el apoyo que Prisma le ha brindado ya tiene una pequeña hacienda.
Don Oscar Elvin su sueño es crecer más en su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Oscar Elvin is 34 years old and single. He doesn't have any dependent children. He lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in Honduras' southern valley. He doesn't have his own home and he has been working selling pork and fish and raising and selling cattle for nine years.

Oscar Elvin's customers are the friends and neighbors in the neighborhood where he lives. He sells his products on the street, going out every morning to the surrounding areas on his bicycle. He also works buying and selling calves and cows.

Oscar Elvin is requesting this loan to buy a cow, because he has found a very good dairy cow for sale. He is very happy to keep working with Prisma. This time he is requesting his tenth loan. He is a good client and with the support Prisma has given him he now has a small ranch. His dream is to further grow with his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013

loans.use: to buy a cow for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Apolonia

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene 7 hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

 Rosa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, urea, abonos, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar mas terrenos para seguir sembrando y viajar fuera del pais , le gusta ver la televiosn en los tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old, in a common law marriage, and has seven children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Desvió De los Amarillo neighborhood of the Ventanas settlement in the Los Rios province.  She is part of the “PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES,” located in the Los Amarillos area of the Ventanas settlement where its people farm and raise.

Rosa raises corn and corral animals such as chickens and pigs.  This loan will allow her to buy fertilizer, urea, compost, and balanced feed.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy more land, continue planting, and travel out of the country.  She likes to watch TV in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is the mother of three grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells various items like canned goods, sugar, eggs, seasonings, soap and rice. Her business started quite a few years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock like sugar and a variety of food to sell. This is very helpful in maintaining her inventory, as well as catering to the needs of her customers.

In the future, Crispina hopes to expand her business to improve her livelihood status and save in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar and a variety of  food to sell.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for seven years.  She earns a better income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the vehicle tires and spare parts. To improve her services, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance for repair and maintenance costs. She always wants to augment her income.  Marisa’s hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school and two underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has been selling sheep and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase animal feeds and vaccine for her goat and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and vaccine for her goat and pigs.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman is a conservative lady, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Nariman was born in 1987. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her husband and three children. Her husband has been helping her to run their project selling goats for two years. Now they need to expand their project by purchasing more goats to raise their profit in order to cover their children's needs and to provide them with the best education. But they don’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, Nariman has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima was born in 1966.  She is married and a mother of 4 who lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour.  Halima has been trying her best to support her husband financially by running her business of accessories, home products and detergents sales since the past year.  She started her project selling a small quantity of accessories and found it profitable. Then she started gradually adding new products.  Now she needs to purchase a larger quantity of accessories, home products and detergents in order to raise her sales.   But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more accessories, detergents and home products for her business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba was born in 1971. She a widow because her husband was born many years ago. Nasiba has a son who is 21 years old. Nasiba works hard to earn money for their living expenses.
