She works in a café and she sews national women's dresses. She had been sewing very wonderful dresses for ten years. She tries to provide her son with a higher education. Her son studies at the university and Nasiba must pay the tuition fees for her son. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus is a 27-year-old man working as a mechanic in Ishaka town. Nicholus has been working as a mechanic since 2007 and is happy it has rewarded his efforts. He also has a small retail shop that is operated by the wife. His business is located in Ishaka town and his clients are all categories of people who need to repair their machines. His major reason for starting the business was to get a clear source of income so that he could provide the needs of his family. He would like to use the 800,000 shillings loan to buy machines to use in his business so that he can serve his customers better. His plans for the future include growing the business so that he can be financially stable. His major challenge is competition, which affects his business negatively, but he believes that if the loan is given he will out-compete his competitors.

loans.use: To buy repair equipment

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en: Yuldosh was born in 1958. He is married and has two sons. He lives in a rural area. He has been busy growing agricultural products for more than five years. Yuldosh grows crops. He has his own land where he works from early morning until late evening. This years, Yuldosh didn’t get a good harvest. He lives poorly. His sons want to go to Russia to find jobs. Yuldosh is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy air tickets to Russia. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy air tickets for his sons to go to Russia to work

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Don Francisco es originario de Estelí, casado y padre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya independientes. De 42 años de edad. Se dedica al pintado automotriz. Inicio su negocio a los quince años, como ayudante de un taller, fue ahí donde aprendió el oficio de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, luego de adquirir experiencia puso su propio negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien. Solicita el crédito para la compra de dos vehículos dañados, darles mantenimiento y luego venderlos a un mejor precio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que con la inversión podrá obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su taller.
texts.en:
Francisco is from Estelí. He is married and the father of three children, two of whom are already independent. He is 42 years old. His work is automotive painting. He started this work at the age of 15, as an assistant in a workshop. Thus he learned the profession of body work and vehicle painting. After acquiring experience, he set up his own business, which has gone very well for him. 

He is requesting the loan to buy two damaged vehicles, in order to repair them and later sell them for a higher price. He believes that the loan will be of great help to him, since with this investment he will be able to obtain higher earnings. His plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of his workshop.

loans.use: to buy two damaged vehicles to repair and resell at a higher price.

loans.name: Rolandi

texts.en:
Rolandi is a 63-year-old married man from Rustavi. He lives with his wife who is a teacher and earns 100 GEL per month. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to create financial stability. 

Rolandi was unable to have a higher education so it is one of the reasons for his unemployment. He has decided to start his own private business that will be lucrative for him. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo will enable him to get a loan of $1600 for purchasing a secondhand car. 

Rolandi will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his family will have better living conditions. 

This loan will be a great support for the family. Rolandi is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham was born in 1978. He is married and a father of three living in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Hisham has been running his only source of income, which is his barbershop, for three years. He started his project using a few tools and serving a few customers. Now he needs to purchase more tools to be able to work professionally and to serve more customers in order to raise his profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his barbershop

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail sales business. This is the source of her income. Norly is applying for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as slippers, shirts, pants, underwear and other clothing. With this loan she will be able to cater to more customers, thus, augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as slippers, shirts, pants, underwear and other clothing

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar was born in 1962. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her husband, who is a security man, and five sons and daughters. Samar has been trying her best to support her husband financially by running her mini-market which she started running one year ago. She started her project at home selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. Then, she opened her own mini-market.  Now she needs to purchase a refrigerator where she can keep her frozen products. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and more food products

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana de 27 años de edad, no estudio pues sus padres no le apoyaron en su momento, ahora es madre soltera de un niño de 5 años de edad, por quien ella trabaja cada día para darle lo mejor de sí. En este año su niño ira al kínder que le queda a 25 minutos, caminando por la calle principal de la comunidad, tiene tres hermanos más quienes están al igual que ella con sus padres.
Ana se dedica a la crianza de especies menores, aves de corral y cerdos en pequeña escala, inicio hace cuatro años por iniciativa propia, el negocio le es muy rentable, pues engorda los cerdos y sino también los destaza para obtener ingresos económicos para la familia y para su hijo. Además, vende tamales y atol por las tardes en la comunidad, le ayuda su hermana y su madre.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  6 cerdos valorados en $50 cada uno y también necesita $100 para la compra de útiles escolares para su niño y uniformes que utilizara en la escuela.
El resto lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la compra de maíz, concentrado y otros para el mantenimiento de los cerdos, ya que actualmente tiene dos cerditos, ya que recién ha vendido dos cerdos en la comunidad.
Con ello esta garantizando que su hijo pueda ir a la escuela de la comunidad, y también tendrá sus cerdos de engorde a los cuales cuidar para posteriormente venderlos en precios mejores y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
Ana construirá su propia casa para su hijo, donde pueda ir haciendo así sus propias cosas para darle a su hijo un mañana mejor.
Planea con sus pequeños ahorros, hacer un corral más grande para crecer y engordar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old. She did not attend university because her parents did not support her at the time. Now she is a single mother with a 5-year-old son, for whose sake she works every day to give the best of herself. This year, her son will go to kindergarten, which is a 25-minute walk away, along the main street of her community. She has three siblings who are in the same situation as she is with their parents. 

Ana works raising small animals, poultry and pigs on a small scale. She started four years ago on her own initiative. The business is quite profitable, since she fattens up the pigs and even butchers them to obtain income for her family and her son. She also sells tamales and atol [a traditional sweet drink] in the evenings in her community, with the help of her sister and her mother. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy 6 pigs valued at $50 each, and she also needs $100 to buy school supplies for her son and uniforms which he will wear at school. She will invest the rest in buying supplies, such as corn, concentrated animal feed and other items to maintain her pigs. She currently has two piglets; she recently sold two pigs in the community.

With this she will ensure that her son can go to the local school, and she will also have her piglets to fatten up, which she will take care of and later sell for a better price and obtain higher returns. 

Ana will build a house of her own for her son, where she can continue working independently to give her son a better future. 

With her small savings, she plans to create a larger enclosure where she can raise and fatten up her pigs.

loans.use: to buy 6 pigs and animal feed, as well as school supplies and uniforms for her son.

loans.name: Adih

texts.en:
Adih and his family live in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Adih is married and has six children. He runs a grocery shop that also sells mobile phone airtime credits. 

He began working with Ruma because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments, as he sees sales opportunities around his neighborhood.

Recently, he took a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions, especially on weekends when more people come to his shop. For the last three months, he has made around $60 - $61 per day just from mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

He hopes that he will be able to improve his business and plans to take other business opportunities in the future. 

In the photo, he is sitting in his grocery shop. Adih thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman with four children,  three of whom attend school, while the eldest is an adult. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Luvuno has been selling goats at the market to the general public. Her main challenge has been unstable market prices. She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds and is now requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha was born in 1962. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her retired husband and six sons and daughters. Aisha has been doing embroidery on clothes and dresses for one year. Then she started to do straw crafts to sell. Her project was profitable for her so she decided to expand it in order to support her family financially. To do so, she needs to buy more hay and fabric in order to raise her productivity and income. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to obtain more raw materials to make embroidered pieces and straw crafts

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun is 27 years old and a resident from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is a mother of three dependent children; one is in school and the remaining two are too young for schooling. The main source of her income is from rice farming. 

The current business which she has worked in for three years has earned her about 21,000 KHR per day. Besides the business that she needs to take care of, she wants to focus on sanitation practices for her entire household as well. However, it is quite challenging for her as she does not have a proper latrine yet. 

To overcome this challenge, she joined a group to get a first loan of 177,000 KHR each with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. This will be done especially for her kids. 

She hopes that the latrine construction will promote proper sanitation practices in her household so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Elvis Roberto

texts.es:
El joven Elvis Roberto de 27  años de edad vive con su esposa,  tiene dos hijos  que depende de él, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don Elvis Roberto vive en casa de alquiler se dedica desde hace 11 años  al negocio de reparación de vehículos en su taller el  cuanta con la ayuda de dos empleados y está muy contento de su negocio porque ha logrado comprar muchas cosas a través de este.
Don Elvis Roberto está solicitando el préstamo para ajustar a comprar un terreno para hacer su casa e instalar su taller, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es un buen cliente es su séptimo préstamo que solicita, su sueño es tener ese terreno para mejorar su calidad de vida.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Diciembre  del 2013
texts.en:
Elvis Roberto, 27, lives with his wife and their two dependent children. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

Elvis Roberto lives in a rental home. For the past 11 years, he has made a living repairing vehicles in his workshop along with his two employees. He is very happy with his business because he has been able to buy many things because of it.

Elvis Roberto is requesting a loan to buy some land where he can build his house and set up a workshop. He is very happy to continue working with Prisma. He is a good customer and this is the seventh loan he is requesting. His dream is to have this land to improve his quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy land for his house.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Enhbat is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. His wife, Otgontsetseg, works at a local shop as a saleswoman. His two sons attend a local kindergarten. 

Enhbat started his bakery business in 2006. He has already established his good name with clients due to his tasty and healthy goods. 

He is now requesting loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase labeling tools and materials to market his products and inventories to continue his business. 

Enhbat is a hardworking and diligent man who takes care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase labeling tools and materials to market his products and inventories to continue his business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con el negocio de venta de ropa y le va muy excelente entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar como por ejemplo polos, chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Maribel is thankful to the investors for the loan and feels happy for the support provided. She wants to continue participating in this project because it helps her to increase business capital and also she feels motivated to continue working in her business. She continues with the business selling clothes and it is going very excellently. So at this time, she needs the loan to buy, for example, polos, sweaters, pants, shirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, for example polo shirts, jackets, trousers, shirts and other things.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino, age 39, is from the village of Rgani. She lives with her school-age son, husband and retired mother-in-law. The family gets a small amount of social assistance because they live without a source of income below the poverty line. In order to generate funds and cover the feeding and household items, she plans to start a cotton mattresses making business. Nino needs money to buy special equipment for scrutching cotton. (This is a mechanical operation that, by breaking and beating the retted flax straw, separates the textile fibers in the stem of the plant from the woody matter and the bark).  Nino will make mattresses and sell her produce among the locals. She will also get orders from them and earn a living. Nino hopes that her initiative will be successful and she will be able to improve the standard of living for her family members in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making cotton mattresses

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Age 25 and a resident of Kampong Thom province, Thea is married and blessed with one little kid. She strives to make a living through her rice farming business and her husband's occupation as a doctor in the village. This is the first time loan for Thea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking an education loan in order to cover the tuition fees for her husband who wants to pursue a Bachelor's Degree in Management. She hopes that her husband can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fees of her husband

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a married woman with two sons and three daughters. She is from Kalaiya in the Bara district of Nepal.

For the last ten years, she has operated a small general store in her neighborhood. She sells goods for daily consumption and grocery items. This has been her main source of income. Her husband also supports her in this business. 

Gita has requested a loan amount of 40,000 NPR to increase her stock of food and grocery items in her shop to meet the increasing demand.

Her hope for the future is to expand the business and to give her children a good education

loans.use: to buy goods for the general store

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “ADELANTE COCACHACRA”  se encuentran pasando el 03 ciclo. Nataly tiene 29 años es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Dedicada a su bodega que aperturo con mucho esfuerzo en donde ofrece productos como son arroz azúcar aceite bebidas y golosinas. años a tras trabajaba como domestica. Es de esta manera que puede sostener a su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de de arroz azúcar aceite bebidas y golosinas. el grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Nataly es la tercera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Adelante Cocachacra" group are in their third loan cycle. Nataly is 29 years old, single and has two dependent children. She is devoted to running her store, which she opened with a great deal of effort, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, drinks and candy. Years ago she worked as a housekeeper. 

In this way she is able to support her family. She will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, drinks and candy. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Nataly is third on the left.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is a 41-year-old man and an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in an IDP Settlement with his wife and five children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last eight years. During these years, Avaz gained enough skills and experience to run the business. 

He chose this crop business because it is profitable, and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes like pilau and dolma are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan families, and they also make fresh punch. 

He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 270 AZN. As these products are in high demand, Avaz wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 2,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This is going to be his third loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ivonne Liseth

texts.es: Ivonne es una señora humilde que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha venido haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda,   sus hijos ya son todos independientes quienes habitan  junto a ella en su casa, doña Ivonne se gana la vida haciendo reposterías por encargo los cuales también sale a vender. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar el muro de la parte posterior de su vivienda, para el cual espera esta sea la última etapa para concluir la obra, está muy contenta porque paso a paso va mejorando su hogar, digno de habitarse tanto para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a humble person who works hard and puts a lot of effort into making improvements to her home. All of her children are adults and they live with her at home. Ivonne works by making made-to-order pastries, which she then sells.

She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to finish a wall in the back of her home. She hopes that this will be the last step in finishing this project. She is very happy because she is improving her home little by little, making it suitable for both her and her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, blocks, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
La señora Milagro de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa  y sus tres  hijos, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de repuestos para bicicleta.
Doña Milagro en su taller se repara y vende los repuestos de bicicletas mismas, sus clientes son amigos y personas que llegan a su negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos como llantas de varios números, rines, neumáticos y accesorios.
Doña Milagro con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su primer crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Doña Milagro su sueño es mejorar su taller.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Milagro is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  She has a home of her own and has been selling bicycle parts for two years.

Milagro repairs bikes in her shop and also sells spare parts.  Her customers are her friends and people who visit her.  She is asking for a loan to buy spare parts such as tires of various sizes, rims, inner tubes, and accessories.

Milagro will improve her income and quality of life with this loan.  This is the first loan she is requesting through Prisma.

Milagro’s dream is to improve her workshop.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2013.

loans.use: to buy bike parts.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa con la venta de comida y con el puesto de venta por lo tanto le va excelente entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas.
texts.en: Delfina is grateful to the investors for the loan, and she feels happy because of the help offered to her. She wants to continue participating in this project because it helps her to increase her business capital, and she also feels motivated to continue working in her business. She continues with the sale of food and with the sales stall, and therefore it is going very well for her, so at this time she needs the loan to buy more supplies, such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other items, for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Pailino

texts.es: El socio agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, él continúa con el negocio de cortar árboles, con la construcción de casas y con la agricultura, él tiene un pequeño terrero agrícola donde siembra papa, olluco, maíz, haba y otras cosas más. Desde muy joven aprendió sobre  la agricultura pues sus padres le enseñaron entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en: The member is thankful to the investors for the loan and feels content about the support provided. He wants to keep participating in this project because it helps him to increase the capital for his business and also he feels motivated to keep working in his business. He continues with the tree cutting business, with house construction and with farming. He has a small piece of farm land where he plants potato, ulloco, maize, beans, and other items. Since he was very young, he learned about farming since his parents taught him so at this time he needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negoci, ella continúa con la venta de pollipapas y salchipapas, ella tiene  un carrito salchipapero donde prepara sus ricos potajes y la podemos encontrar en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba, ella sale a vender desde las 2pm hasta las 9pm de lunes a domingos entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, salchicha, papas y otros insumos.
texts.en: Teodosia is grateful to lenders for this loan and she is happy to have their support. She wants to keep participating in this project because it helps her to increase working capital. It also motivates her to keep working at her business. She is still selling chicken and sausages. She has a sausage cart where she makes delicious stews. She can be found in one of the markets in the city of Challabamba. She goes out to sell between 2 p.m. and 9 p.m. from Monday through Sunday. She is now requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, sausage, and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, sausages, and potatoes.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: La señora Yessica tiene 23 años, es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos, estudio hasta el nivel bachillerato y por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar, se dedica todos los días de la semana a la venta de comida en una caseta alquilada, solicita crédito para la compra de un refrigerador con el fin de conservar los alimentos que necesita para cocinar y refrigerar refrescos para vender, de esta forma podrá obtener mayores ingresos y lograra culminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Yesica, 23, is single and doesn't have any children. She went to school through high school but due to a lack of financial resources, she wasn't able to continue. Every day, she sells food from her rented food stand. She is requesting this loan to buy a refrigerator so she can preserve the food she needs to cook and to keep drinks that she will sell cold. This will bring her more income and she will be able to finish school.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, a sus 38 años de edad, se gana la vida trabajando de manera independiente, desde hace 9 años está desempeñándose como recreacionista y animadora de eventos con shows de títeres, marionetas, juegos inflables para niños, entre otros, actividad que realiza durante los fines de semana y, de manera alterna también vende mercancía como ropa y calzado para dama; así genera los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar.
Su labor es ardua y le exige mucha fortaleza física, pues debe cargar gran cantidad de material para realizar su trabajo, sin embargo, esto la motiva para seguir adelante y para un futuro cercano sueña con adquirir su propio medio de transporte que le facilitaría los desplazamientos de una manera más ágil y cómoda.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, pues con el dinero desea comprar materia prima (telas, hilos, nylon, entre otros), comprar un inflable y además abastecerse de mercancía al por mayor (zapatos, blusas, jeans, sandalias, entre otros) para ofrecer en la temporada decembrina; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de insumos para elaborar los títeres según su show, además podrá prestar un servicio más completo a nuevos clientes en el campo de recreación, dando como resultado un incremento en el nivel de ingresos que percibe por su labor.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old, works independently.  She has been working as a receptionist and promoter of puppet shows, inflatable games, and other things on the weekend for nine years.  She also sells merchandise such as women’s shoes and  generates the income she needs to help her husband with the household expenses.

Her labor is arduous and she put forth lots of physical effort, because she must carry lots of material to do her work, however this motivates her to forge ahead.  She hopes to have her own means of transportation in the near future that will make it easier to move her things faster and more comfortably.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies (fabric, thread, nylon, etc.), and stock up on items (shoes, blouses, jeans, sandals, etc.) so she can offer more for the December season.  This will allow her to have more supplies in stock to make puppets for each show and she will also be able to provide more complete service and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, 37, is a villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has four kids to take care of as all of them are in school.

To cover the daily basic needs in her household, she raises ducks and chickens as the main source of income, while her husband drives motor-taxi for a fee. Her 15 years of engagement in her current business has enabled her to earn 30,600 KHR per day, of which 7,800 KHR is her savings remaining after she offsets with daily expenses. This is not the first loan for Rom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has successfully repaid, has enabled her to keep her kids in school. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy ducks, duck feed, and to build more duck coops. Moreover, she will spend some portion of her loan to fix her motorbike as well. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her larger business.

loans.use: to buy ducks, duck feed, and to build more duck pens

loans.name: Ncucumo Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Ms. Donanta is a member of Ncucumo Twimukye group and is a tailor who has done tailoring since 2010. She is the mother of seven children and they are all in school.

In addition to tailoring, she also trades in produce which gives her additional income that helps her cater to the needs of her children. Her business is located in Ncucumo, Kitwe in the Bushenyi District, and her clients are mainly people from around Bushenyi. She started the business with the purpose of generating income which she would use to provide the basic needs of life to her children.

Donanta would like to use the money to buy more produce and she hopes that her business will grow in future and she will get enough money to build a house.  Her main challenge is transport since the means of transport in her area of operation is very poor. She describes herself as an honest person, and her personality has helped her to keep in the market.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin is 43 years old and married. She is a villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is the mother of two sons who are in school. 

For the sake of her kids, she grows paddy rice as her main source of income and sells banana leaves to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years. Chin has been with VisionFund for ages as well. The positive impact of her past loans, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to support her business with a decent income in return as well as to renovate her house and keep her kids in school.

For this loan cycle, she seeks for a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike to support her business as well as for commuting, and to buy banana leaves for resale. She hopes to get a good income from her business.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike and to buy banana leaves for resale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Kong is 34 years old and married. She has seven children to cater to: three are too young for schooling and four are in school.

She struggles for a living via rice and pineapple farming on a one-hectare area each. To supplement the family’s income, she works for others for a fee. This is the business that she has had since she was 18 years old.

This is the third loan for Kong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it has helped her improve her lifestyle to be better than before. Now she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can collect her yield on time so she can get a good selling price.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She and her husband work hard to provide them with the best education and living.

She is a hard-worker with a very good reputation in her region, she has seventeen years of experience in this domain. In 2002, she established her current salon, which now needs maintenance. Thus, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy special living room furniture and chairs for her beauty salon, in addition to doing the necessary decoration that will attract new customers and increase her income.

Afaf is working hard to keep on providing her family and customers with the best living facilities. She hopes that in the future she can expand her business and open a special beauty therapy section which she is sure that will reply to all of her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To buy special living room furniture and chairs for her beauty salon, in addition to doing the necessary decoration that will attract new customers.

loans.name: Exuperia

texts.en:
Exuperia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Exuperia is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Exuperia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Exuperia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Mosheer

texts.en:
Mosheer is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of one small daughter.

Mosheer works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Mosheer decided to buy a small rickshaw and transfer goods for the local traders. It helps the family with part of their expenses.

Mosheer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders. By taking this loan, Mosheer will be able to improve his business and also his income. Mosheer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods for local traders

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit already has planned on taking his second loan from Kiva. He is still running his business. Davit is an auto electrician and converted his own garage into an auto repair shop. Davit lives with his wife, parents and his two sisters. He has already become a father of two cheerful and nice children.

Davit and his father work very hard to provide for their family. Over all, Davit is satisfied with his occupation since he already has many loyal customers who, over many years, are used to visiting his garage when having various problems with their cars, so he earns good money out of it.

Davit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy some materials and equipment for his business in order to raise the quality and the speed of his work and service.

loans.use: to buy some materials and equipment for his business

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Doña Elia es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están a su cargo. Tiene 55 años de edad. Es de oficio técnica radiológica, el cual le ha generado un salario digno para su hogar. Su meta es terminar con las mejoras del sistema sanitarios. Solicita el crédito para mejorar el saneamiento se su vivienda, con el fin de garantizar  a sus hijos una red sanitaria higiénica. Estima que le crédito le será de mucho beneficio ya que tendrá un saneamiento seguro y limpio. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda
texts.en: Elia, 55, is a single mother of four children, two of whom are under her care. She works as an X-ray technician, which has provided her with a sufficient salary for her home. Her goal is to finish with improvements to the sanitation system. She is requesting a loan to improve sanitation in her home so that her children have a hygienic sanitation network. She thinks this loan will be a great help to her because she will have safe and clean sanitation. Her plan for the future is to keep improving her home.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in her home.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz, who is a 32-year-old married man, lives in Vakhani, Kharagauli district. He has a wife and 4 children. 

The family runs agricultural activities. They have 4 cows, 50 trees of nuts and a plot of agricultural land. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, he was unable to study a professional career. Malkhaz works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and looking after 4 cows, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. They also use the milk products to feed the family. 

As the family has only a seasonal income, Malkhaz decided to start a firewood business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting a businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,300 GEL for purchasing bulls and starting a firewood business. Malkhaz will bring firewood from the forest and serve local people. The new business initiative will give Malkhaz a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: To buy bulls and start a firewood trading business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Salome, a farmer and the mother of 2 children living in Kitale in North Rift, Kenya. Both her children are of school-going age and so farming is her major source of income where she produces and sells milk, eggs and maize.  Besides farming, she has a motorbike which she uses to offer transportation services as an extra source of income. In farming she loves poultry keeping and horticultural farming.

Salome chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer loans to small-scale farmers at a low interest rate, and also they process the loans quickly. This loan will enable her to generate more income, which will enable her to pay school fees for her children and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en: Sophan is 34 years old and a married mother blessed with three schoolchildren. The rest of her family resides in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. For the sake of her entire family, she grows rice as the main source of income. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This business has generated her about 31,600 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Sophan’s group consisting of two borrowers. Sophan has wisely managed her past loan, to upgrade her living condition to better than before and to keep her kids in school.  She has paid it back completely.  For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking  500,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop. She hopes that she can keep improving her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a business man operating a retail shop in Kizinda in Ishaka. He started the business in 2007 and has seen it grow from one step to another. 

Ephraim works 6 days a week and works for ten hours daily. He also owns a banana plantation which earns him some money which he uses as additional income to cater to the needs of the children. His clients are the dwellers of the same area where his business is located.

His objective in starting the business was to get money to support his family and he hopes that if the loan of 3,000,000 UGX (three million shillings) is given, he will restock the shop, get enough money, put up a good home and support his family. Ephraim also believes that his children will get better educations since he will get enough money from the business.

loans.use: to buy household use items to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Chhan's Group

texts.en:
Chhan is 49 years old and a widowed mother residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Chhan's main sources of income are her two-hectares of rice farm and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years and she gets almost 37,000 KHR each day from it. 

This is the fifth loan for Chhan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid back her past loan completely. Nowadays, her living conditions are better than before. Now, she is forming a group to get a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 5,000,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her loan portion to pay the fee for harvesting her paddy rice and to buy good sesame seedlings to grow to supplement her income. She very much hopes to harvest her crop in a timely way.

loans.use: to pay the fee for harvesting her paddy rice and to buy good sesame seedlings.

loans.name: Santa Mercedes

texts.es:
Santa tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo y con sus hijos de 9 y 12 años, Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Santa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Carlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia.
Le gusta caminar y tejer.
texts.en:
Santa is 53 years old.  She lives with her partner in a common-law relationship.  She also lives with her children, ages 9 and 12.  She likes to walk and knit.  She lives in the Mocache canton, Los Ríos province.

Her credit group is called Juntos Triunfaremos [Together We Will Triumph].  It is located in the John F Kennedy 2 neighborhood, which belongs to the Mocache cantón, near Ventanas.  Its members work in farming and livestock.

Santa works in farming; for a number of years she has planted corn and rice.  She buys her products in Ventanas at Agroquímica Carlita, and sells them in the market of the same place.

The loan she has requested is for the purchase of soil amendments and fertilizers for corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family to use, and for investment.  Her dream is to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and soil amendments.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Don Reynaldo tiene 53 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Casado y padre de cinco hijos ya independientes.  Es de oficio carpintero, se dedica a la carpintería. Inicio en este negocio hace pocos años y con pocas herramientas, poco  a poco iba elaborando puertas y ventanas. Con las ganancias obtenidas fue ahorrando para comprar más herramientas. Actualmente vende más productos y tiene más pedidos. Su meta próxima es culminar con las mejoras del local. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de su local y comprar materia prima, con el fin de tener un negocio con buenas condiciones y cómodo. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que tendrá el mejor local de carpintería. Su plan futuro es seguir con la producción de sus productos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 53-year-old native of Esteli. He is married and the father of 5 children, all now independent. His trade is carpentry which he is practicing. Renaldo began this business a few years ago with few tools. Little by little, he has been creating doors and windows. With the earnings obtained, he has saved in order to buy more tools. Presently, he sells more products and receives more orders.

Reynaldo's next goal is to finish improving his shop. He is requesting a loan for the purpose of enhancing the shop's infrastructure and to purchase primary materials, in order to have a more comfortable business in better condition. He is convinced that the loan will be of much help, since he will have a better carpenter shop.

Reynaldo's future plan is to continue building his products.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his carpentry shop and to buy primary materials.

loans.name: Sea's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sea is 59 years old and the father of four kids. He deals with his daily necessary expenses from two hectares of rice farming as the main source of income and supplements his income via working for others for a fee. The business that he has had for 34 years has generated for him about 29,000 KHR per day.

Sea, a first-time borrower, forms a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Sea is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while his joint member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to pay for reaping fees and to buy a pig for raising as supplementary income. He hopes that he can harvest his yield on time and to raise his pig healthily so that he can get a good income from his business.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees and to buy a pig to raise

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina was born in the year 1994. She is not married and lives with her parents. She did good studies at school and entered university two years ago, after graduating from school. 

Nowadays, Nigina is a student of the National University of Tajikistan. She studies in the faculty of World Economics. She is a second-year student and must pay her second year tuition fees. She is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Joel es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, gracias a la oportunidad que sus padres le brindaron de que estudiara. Esta soltero, no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con sus padres, a quien les ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Joel se dedica a cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol, desde la edad de 15 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre, quien toda su vida ha sido agricultor, e inculco en el hijo el trabajo y sobre todo la responsabilidad y honestidad.  Además, gracias a su papá aprendió a realizar labores agrícolas con tracción animal, específicamente con bueyes. En donde, son su fuente de trabajo e ingresos y  necesita ir renovándolos, porque el desgaste que tienen cada año, por realizar estos trabajos son muy grandes. Aparte de las labores de siembra y maíz que realiza.


El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar insumos agrícolas y poder tener la oportunidad de continuar trabajando en la siembra de maíz y frijol. Con el préstamo podrá comprar fertilizantes, semilla, plaguicidas para usar en forma preventiva, para el control de plagas y enfermedades.


Joel tiene el sueño de continuar estudiando en Educación Superior,  para esto es necesario que continúe esforzándose como hasta hoy lo ha realizado. Así, lograra ayudar a su familia a mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos. Con las ganancias de la siembra de maíz y frijol, piensa ahorrar una parte para cancelar las cuotas de la universidad y complementar los gastos de transporte y alimentación y la otra parte para cancelar el crédito que ha solicitado.
texts.en:
Joel is a 22-year-old young man. He completed 9th grade thanks to the opportunity to study that was given to him by his parents. He's single and doesn't have any children. He currently lives with his parents, and he helps them pay for household expenses.

Joel grows 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. He has been in this line of work since he has 15 and he learned it from his father. His father has been a farmer all his life and he taught his son to work and above all to be responsible and honest. Besides, thanks to his father he learned to do farm work using animal traction, specifically oxen. They are his source of employment and his means of livelihood, and he needs to keep on renewing them, because they face a great deal of weariness each year from doing this type of work. That's in addition to his work on growing corn.

The loan will be used to purchase farming supplies so that he can have the opportunity to continue working on his corn and bean crops. With the loan he'll purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to be used as a preventive measure for pest and disease control.

Joel dreams of moving forward with his college education. For that purpose he needs to keep on working hard, as he has done so far. That way he'll be able to help his family improve their living conditions. He plans to save part of the profits he makes from growing corn and beans in order to pay for college and cover his additional expenses with food and transportation. He also plans to use another part of the profits to repay the loan he has requested.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to be used as a preventive measure for pest and disease control.

loans.name: Edilito

texts.en: Edilito is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Edilito is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing supplies. With this he will be able to catch and sell more fish at the market. Edilito hopes to make his business a success. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
58-year-old Kumba lives in the town of West Point with three of her children. Her husband works in the government of Liberia. Her children's ages are from 19 to 30, only one of whom still lives at home and attends school. The older ones live in the same area on their own. Over the past 6 years Kumba has been involved with business. She is now selling water by the sack at retail prices. 

Although she does not face any major problem, she finds that thinking of increasing her business volume makes her worry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to improve her business and her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es: El señor Nehemías, es soltero y trabaja de forma independiente para ayudar a su familia ya que tienen pocos recursos economicos. Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, pero como no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, solicita un crédito para ampliar sus plantaciones de cítricos, así podrá incrementar sus ingresos y lograra mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Nehemías is single and works independently to help his family, as they have few financial resources. He farms but does not have sufficient money. He is requesting a loan to expand his citrus plantation. This way he will be able to increase his income and succeed in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand his citrus plantation.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is widowed with 8 children, and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren who are school-going). She has a business of a food stall and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, bags of sweet and Irish potatoes and cassava to sell. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Teopista is hoping to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for the grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, bags of sweet and Irish potatoes, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en: Gracelyn is married with an only child. She works in a private company and at the same time manages their own farm to make a living. She has been five years in the business of growing and harvesting coconut and other crops, and she earns well from this. To improve the farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy seedlings and fertilizer. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Flor Amelia

texts.es: Flor, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, y reside en Arizona, Atlántida junto a una hija. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva dos años de vender ropa para damas, caballeros  y niños, también vende accesorios, granos básicos, churros, refrescos, dulces, galletas y pan. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio con mercadería de ropa y golosinas, refrescos, accesorios como ganchos, colas, aretes etc. Para aprovechar en esta temporada y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan es mejorar su casa y darle estudio a su hija menor.
texts.en: Flor, 45, is a single mother with three children.  She and a daughter live in Arizona, Atlántida.  Flor has long made a living buying and selling things and, for the last two years, she has operated a clothing sales business.  She sells clothing for men, women and children, along with accessories and miscellaneous other products such as grains, bread and snacks.  Flor is applying for an 8,000-lempiras loan that she will use to stock her business with everything from clothes to snacks.  The investment will allow her to make the most of the coming holiday season and increase her income.  She hopes to make improvements to her house and to ensure that her daughter can continue in school.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 5 years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma owns a general store in her village, selling assorted kinds of grocery goods to make a living. She earns well from this business and that's why she wants to expand it. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to build a shelter for her store to sell her goods to her customers in a more comfortable way. In the future, she wants to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha operates a machine shop to make a living. In this business for many years, she earns a good income. Editha has requested a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to repair a welding machine and buy some tools and oil in order to improve services. 

Editha wants to sustain her business to provide a legacy for her dependents in the future.

loans.use: to repair a welding machine and buy some tools and oil

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 40 years old and has a third grade education. She is married to a police officer and has four children between 9 and 25 years old. Some are in school and some live at home.

For the past five years Sarah has been selling slippers. The problem she is facing is a small inventory. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 LRD to buy more slippers to sell.

Sarah’s hope is to build a house and send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates getting her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
This is Mupa. She previously accessed a loan that she used to add more stock to her grocery store. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Kshs 30,000 loan to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Joannah

texts.en: Joannah lives in West Point. She is 50 years old and stopped her education in the 11th grade. She is single and has five children between the ages of 18 and 33, only one of whom is in school and lives at home. For 11 years she has been selling soft drinks and cold water. She faces a problem during the rainy season, because she does not have enough money to build a shop for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business. Joannah's plans are to build a shop and a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo viene de una familia humilde tiene 4 hermanos menores, ahora está estudiando la carrera de Psicología, y comenta que su  meta es obtener el título de licenciatura en Psicología y de esa manera el día de mañana tener más posibilidades de conseguir un lugar de trabajo, un puesto laboral donde le permita realizarse y tener una mejor calidad de vida y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar sus útiles de la universidad y también para sus gastos de manutención en su día a día
texts.en:
Rodrigo has 4 younger brothers and sisters.  He comes from a modest background but he's in college now, studying for a degree in psychology.  His goal, he says, is to graduate and work as a psychologist.  Finishing his degree is a route to a better life, a life that would also allow him to help his family.
Rodrigo is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for school-related expenses.

loans.use: to pay school-related expenses.

loans.name: Buenos Emprendedores Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo  “Buenos Emprendedores” y está conformado por 05 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Nuria de 26 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos menores de edad. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas íntimas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de trusas y medias. El anhelo de Nuria es de tener su propio puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El nuevo grupo “Buenos Emprendedores” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Nuria es la segunda del lado derecho, viste chompa morada y pantalón negro en brazos lleva a su menor hijo. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo esta Jhon la cual no llego a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the new group “Buenos Emprendedores,” and it is made up of five members enthusiastic to begin working. Nuria is 26, married, and has three minor children.

Currently she sells underwear, which she does as a street vendor.  On this occasion she has requested the loan in order to buy underpants and stockings.

Nuria's desire is to have her own stand where she can sell her products. The new group "Buenos Emprendedores" is grateful to the Kiva investors for the help offered. Nuria is the second on the right, wearing a purple sweater and black pants. She is holding her youngest child in her arms. 

In the upper part of the photo on the left is Jhon, who did not arrive in time for the picture due to work.

loans.use: To buy underpants and stockings.

loans.name: Masis

texts.en:
Masis lives in Kapan in the Syunik region. He is married and has three children, all of them school-aged. 

Masis has already received a successful loan from Kiva which he used for his first business, manufacturing construction blocks and panels. The loan amount helped him to buy an inventory of raw materials. 

Masis also owns a poultry farm where he breeds hens and sells a lot of eggs. This business earns a good income for his family.

Now, Masis is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD to repair the barn for his chickens and to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.use: to repair the barn for his chickens and to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijas que ya son mayores de edad. María se dedica a la venta de productos regionales. Su principal producto de trabajo es el maíz en grano o maíz molido que adquiere de otros vendedores, aunque también vende arroz, plátano o animales domésticos comestibles, tiene un local de venta instalado en su casa que es muy concurrido por los vecinos y ocasionales clientes que pasan por la zona. Algunas veces lleva sus productos a otras ciudades para venderlos en los mercados o cuando tiene pedidos de clientes específicos y retorna a su pueblo después de una semana de trabajo. Atiende a todos siempre con amabilidad y alegría ya que ha aprendido que el buen trato hace que sus clientes vuelvan a comprarle. Se dedica a este trabajo cerca de 25 años pero su local lleva ya 15 años de funcionamiento, tiempo en el cual a llegado a ser muy conocida. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1000, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos tipos de granos por sacos como arroz, maíz y frijol e invertirá también en la compra de racimos de plátano.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old. She is a single mother, and she lives in her home with her two daughters who are now adults. Maria works selling regional products. Her main work product is corn kernels or ground corn that she gets from other sellers. She also sells rice, bananas, and livestock. She has a store in her house that is visited often by her neighbors and occasional customers that pass through. Sometimes she takes her products to other cities to sell them in markets or when she has orders from specific clients, and she will return to her village after a week of work. She attends to everyone with kindness and happiness, as she has learned that being treated well causes her clients to come back to buy more things at her store.She has been in this line of work for 25 years, but her store has been running for 15 years. During this time she has become very well-known. At this time she asks for 1,000 PEN. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, because she will feel secure moving her business forward. On the other hand, she promises to pay her loans back on time. With the sum requested, she will buy various types of grains, such as sacks of rice, corn, and beans. She will also invest in buying bunches of bananas.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice, corn, beans, and bananas.

loans.name: Jemah

texts.en:
Jemah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 41 years old. She did not attend school, but she is engaged in business. She is married, with six children between the ages of 24 and 12. Two of them are in school and they all live at home. 

For the past 20 years, Jemah has been involved in a business. Presently, she sells oil, garlic, and flour, etc. in the local market. She received a little amount of money from her mother to establish her business and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a good profit. 

Jemah is requesting a loan to purchase oil, garlic, and flour, etc. to increase her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, garlic, and flour, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Silvia es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, de 36 años de edad. Madre soltera de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa (tienda). Negocio que inicio trabajando en la tienda de una tía, y tiempo después su papa le ayudo financieramente para que instalara su propia tienda. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda bien diversificada en ropa. Su meta es crecer en su negocio lo más pronto posible y garantizarse una vejez tranquila. Solicita el crédito para comprar: pantalones, camisas, ropas para niños, faldas, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar mercadería nueva y variada. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá diversificar sus artículos y así aumentar sus ventas. Su plan futuro es contratar vendedores ambulantes en las zonas del país.
texts.en:
Silvia is originally from the city of Estelí and is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.  She is a businesswoman and has a clothing store.  She started in this line of work by working in her aunt's store and her father gave her some financial support that allowed her to start her own business.

Currently, her store is well stocked with many kinds of clothing.  Her goal is to expand her business as soon as possible and save up so she can have a relaxed retirement.

She is asking for a loan to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes, skirts, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to offer new, unique merchandise.  She believes that the loan will help her out a lot, since she will be able to diversify her wares and increase her sales.  Her plans for the future include hiring street vendors to work in different parts of the country.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, children's clothes, skirts, and other things.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is 28 years old. He lives in Gavar in the Gegharkunik region. At the moment, he lives alone and has no higher education.

After his army service, he worked in Russia for a foreign construction company. During the last three years, he became seriously engaged in rabbit breeding at his small farm. He finds that rabbit meat is very profitable to sell. In his house's yard, he keeps the rabbits separated in small cages.

Aramayis has plans to enlarge his farm. He is asking for a loan of 900,000 AMD in order to buy more rabbits and rabbit food.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and rabbit food.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, tiene 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside con ellos y un nieto en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Hace 5 años decidió por tener un negocio y ha logrado vender refrescos y golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas y otros.  El préstamo que solicita es el séptimo ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más refrescos, churros, dulces, pan, galletas, y otros para vender. Su plan es obtener ingresos para mejorar su casa y poderle ayudar a su nieto con la educación.
texts.en: Francisca, 53, and her husband have 4 children.  The family, including one grandchild, live together in the rural town of Tela, Atlántida.  Francisca decided to open her own business 5 years ago and has built a successful drinks and snacks business.  She sells soft drinks, churros, cookies and other snacks.  She is applying for a 7,000-lempiras loan that she will use to buy merchandise for her drinks and snacks business.  For the future, she wants to make enough money to improve her house and help her grandson continue in school.

loans.use: to stock her drinks and snacks business.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sophea is a young mother in her late 20s. Currently, she makes a living selling grocery items. To earn additional income for her kids, she works for others for a fee. Sophea has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles and has had a successful repayment. The positive impact of her loan has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is half of a group of two getting a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes that this purchase will return her more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Dismar

texts.en: To make a living, Dismar operates a family member's business providing motorcycle transport services and has been engaged in this business for more than 12 years. He earns well from this and he has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used for vehicle repair. To improve the services, Dismar borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy tires to replace the old ones. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Paskari

texts.en:
Paskari is 34 years old and married with two children, one of whom attends school in Kagadi. He also lives with two children who are orphans. Paskari is an agricultural produce dealer in a nearby trading centre.

Paskari has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to improve his businesses by buying more stock of the agricultural produce, this being a harvest season. He is also has a community school where he earns extra income to supplement his business.

Paskari’s dream is to improve the lives of his family and the community, and that’s why he has started the community school. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce such as maize and millet

loans.name: Mujeres Humildes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Humildes  se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de comités, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y es así como quieren poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde quieren ir mejorando su situación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marisol quien tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de comestibles, bebidas, y golosinas, y comenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, ya que sus productos son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Marisol se destaca por ser una persona que lucha y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Marisol solicita de este crédito para la compras, de panificados, conservantes, carne, verduras para poder ampliar más su negocio  lo que  le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Humildes group is in its first loan cycle in the program committee. They are learning to work together and they hope that this will allow them to help their families. They are in the Poverty Elimination program, where they want to improve their situations.

One of the members is Marisol, who has a small restaurant where she sells all kinds of food, drinks, and soda. She says that she has very good customers and that her products are highly sought-after. Marisol is known as a person who works hard and makes the effort to move forward.

Marisol is requesting this loan to buy baked goods, preservatives, meat, and vegetables to expand her business. This will help her firm up her business plan, which will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, preservatives, meat, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es: Pascuala agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con sus actividades económicas como la agricultura y la ganadería por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un torito para hacerlo engordar y hacerlo crecer para luego venderlo en alguna feria.
texts.en: Pascuala wants you to know that she has made a success of your past loans and is grateful for this one.  She wants to continue her connection to the project because it has allowed her to build the working capital she's needed to establish her business.  Furthermore, your support for the project is motivation, she says, to continue the business.  Pascuala has long operated a farming and livestock business.  She will use this loan to buy a young bull that she will fatten and ultimately sell for a profit.

loans.use: to purchase a young bull.

loans.name: Norma Dinora

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de embutidos, y hace dos años decidió por dedicarse a la venta de comida y también vende cosméticos. Elabora pollo frito con tajadas de banano verde y  esta comida la vende por encargos. De este negocio ella cubre la manutención de sus hijos. ya ha solicitado varios prestamos a ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es el séptimo préstamo y es por 7,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar carne de pollo, harina de maíz, condimentos y otros insumos para la elaboración de tamales y también va comprar ropa para damas y niños y vender en esta temporada. 
Tiene como meta darles el estudio a sus hijos y lograr tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Norma is 37 years old and is a single mother of 2 children.  She lives in a village within the Tela municipality, which is in Atlántida.  She has always worked in sales.  Previously, she worked selling snacks.  Two years ago, she decided to start selling food and also cosmetics.  She makes fried chicken with slices of green banana and sells it by order.

With what she makes from her business, she is able to take care of her children.  She has already asked for several ODEF loans.  The loan she is currently asking for is her 7th loan and is for 7,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy chicken, corn flour, condiments, and other supplies to make tamales.  In addition, she will buy women's and children's clothing to sell during this season.

One of her goals is to allow her children to go to school and have her own house.

loans.use: buy women's and children's clothing and supplies for tamale-making.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela es madre de un hijo de 7 años de edad y felizmente casada.  Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como independiente, realizando manicure y pedicure a domicilio, este oficio lo aprendió en un curso de capacitación en belleza que realizó, pero,  con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, ella tomó la iniciativa de comenzar a trabajar sola, diariamente desde primeras horas del o cuando sus clientes requieren el servicio. En el momento desea ampliar su portafolio de productos y quiere incursionar en el área de la belleza, por lo que se anima a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, para comprar enseres y utensilios de trabajo (tijeras, barberas, cepillos, secador, plancha, entre otros) y una silla de peluquería; esto le permitirá comenzar a ser más productiva en su propio negocio y podrá realizar nuevos ingresos para su familia.
Ángela sueña con tener la capacidad de formar un hogar próspero y existoso, además desea seguir trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante el establecimiento y hacer de él su principal fuente de ingresos, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Angela is the mother of a seven year old boy and she is happily married.  She works independently doing manicures and pedicures from her home.  She learned how to do this work by taking a beauty course and because her goal is to earn a higher income, she decided to work alone.  She works every day from the early hours of the morning or whenever her customers request her services. Currently she wants to expand the portfolio of services that she offers to add beauty services.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy beauty equipment and tools such as scissors, hair trimmers, brushes, dryers, irons - and also to buy a salon chair.  This will enable her to be more productive in her business and to earn new income for her family.

Angela dreams of having the ability to create a prosperous and successful living.  She also dreams to continue working hard to make her business successful, as her business is her main source of income, in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools for her work such as scissors, hair trimmers, brushes, dryers, irons, and a salon chair.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria, tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en Arizona, Atlántida.
