Hace 11 años que estableció su propia pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, productos lácteos, golosinas etc.  Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 13,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pan, churros, harina y refrescos para vender en esta temporada  y obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es seguir mejorando el negocio y mantenerlo surtido.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and is a widow.  She lives in Arizona (within Atlántida).  She started her own grocery store 11 years ago and sells groceries such as basic grains, soft drinks, dairy products, sweets, etc.  This is her third Kiva loan and it is for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use the money to buy goods such as rice, sugar, beans, lard, eggs, bread, churros, flour, and soft drinks to sell during this season.  In this way, she will be able to make bigger profits and work towards her goal of improving her business and keeping it well stocked.

loans.use: Comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pan, churros, harina y refrescos para vender.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es: Maria tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella tiene establecido su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, pastas, productos de aseo, embutidos, lácteos, churros, dulces, etc.  Ya  ha solicitado varios prestamos para el negocio, con el actual es el noveno ciclo y es por 25,000 lempiras, para surtir de mas productos como arroz, azúcar, churros,  huevos, manteca, leche, refrescos, especias, y golosinas. Su propósito es aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. Ella sueña con que sus hijos se gradúen y tener su negocio  surtido.
texts.en: Maria, 35, and her husband have two children.  They live in the rural town of Choloma, Cortes.  Maria has a corner grocery where she sells everyday products such as grains, soft drinks, sugar, butter, pasta, toiletries, canned goods, dairy products, snacks, etc.  She has borrowed for the business before and this loan for 25,000 lempiras will be her ninth from the bank.  She will use it to stock her business with rice, sugar, churros, eggs, butter, milk, soft drinks and snacks.  Her goal is to increase her inventory and, in turn, her sales.  For the future, she wants a full stock of merchandise for the store and the opportunity for her children to finish school.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Boyir

texts.en: Boyir was born in 1963. He is married and has four children. Boyir lives with his family in a rural area. He worked in Russia. Some months ago, he returned to Tajikistan. He has a combine but it is in bad condition. Boyir is going to repair this combine and begin his business. He plans to work with this combine on farms and in this way, earn a living. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to repair the combine. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his combine

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en: Shumila is a vigorous 30-year-old who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing her revenues to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more threads, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married and, to make a living, she helps her husband work on their own rice farm. It is their main source of income and, for seven years, she has earned well for the family. 

Jovita borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides. She always find ways to improve the farm, to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood, age 30, deals in animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income, but she needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase two more goats. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio es de la Ciudad de Encarnación, es casado tiene un hijo, quien es su inspiración para poder trabajar e ir mejorando cada día. Comenta que su familia es su pilar y su fortaleza.
Julio es mecánico de motocicletas ya hace varios años, trabaja en su propia casa, y ya tiene una clientela formado gracia al trabajo garantizado que realiza. El crédito que pide es para la compra de repuestos y accesorios que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Julio is from the city of Encarnación. He is married and has one son, who is his inspiration to work and improve every day. He says that his family is his foundation and his strength.

Julio has been a motocyle mechanic for several years. He works in his own home and he has an established customer base due to the guaranteed work he completes. He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and accessories so he can keep working and fighting to improve.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eugenio está casado con la Sra. Olga desde hace varios años.  Tienen 2 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, que ambos criaron con mucho sacrificio y que hoy ya son personas de bien, útiles a la sociedad.
Eugenio trabaja en compra-venta  de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que venía ahorrando de otros trabajos que  realizaba y hoy gracias al trabajo emprendido tiene una casa cómoda y con todas las necesidades del hogar. 
Solicita el crédito para aumentar su capital para la compra de materiales reciclados para la reventa ya que día a día necesita dinero para realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
Eugenio has been married to Olga for several years. They have two children who are adults and independent. They were raised with much sacrifice and they are both good people who contribute to society.

Eugenio works in buying and selling recycled items. He started with a little capital that he had saved from other jobs. Today, thanks to this work, he has a comfortable home with all the necessities.

He is requesting a loan to increase his capital so he can buy recycled materials to sell because he needs money to make purchases day to day.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Jovenes Unidos En Cristo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jóvenes Unidos en Cristo  está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de Jóvenes, donde cada uno quiere poder emprender un trabajo o continuar con el que viene haciendo, para que así puedan sentirse útiles y también poder aportar un poco a los gastos de la casa.
Cesar forma parte de este grupo,  y comenta que se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedidos, y que gracias a eso está teniendo un poco de ingresos para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa y así aligerar un poco la carga que eso implica. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y por medio de las capacitaciones seguir creciendo. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar zapatos y poder así venderlos y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Jóvenes Unidos en Cristo is in its second loan cycle.  In this group of young people, each member wants to be able to learn a new skill or to continue working in a current job in order to feel useful and also to contribute to some of the household expenses.

Cesar is part of this group and says that he sells shoes by foot. Thanks to this work, he makes a small income and can help pay some of the household expenses. By contributing to the household expenses, he helps alleviate some of the burden on others in his household.

His goal is to be able to continue working and to get more training to expand his skills.  This loan will be used to buy shoes to sell so that he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Daysi Dominga

texts.es: La señora Daysi, es una humilde costurera que hace sus trabajos en su casa de habitación, junto a su esposo busca la manera de mejorar las condiciones de su  vivienda, este crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales para poner el piso en la parte posterior de su casa, es una  inversión que le permitirá ir mejorando las condiciones de vida con un piso solido y sobre todo contribuye a la buena higiene del hogar. Daysi en el futuro espera construir ahí mismo un cuarto  el que pueda alquilar para mejorar sus ingresos, ya que hoy en día la canasta básica está más cara y tiene que buscar la manera de encontrar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Daysi is a humble seamstress that works from home.  She and her husband are searching for ways to improve the conditions of their home.  This loan is for buying the materials needed to install a floor in the back part of the house.  This is an investment that will permit her to improve her living conditions with a solid floor, but above all, to improve the hygiene of the household.  

Daysi hopes that in the future she can build a bedroom that she can rent out to increase her income.  Currently, basic living expenses are becoming more expensive and she needs to find a way to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Imer

texts.es:
Imer tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Cabramayo una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Imer is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the village of Cambramayo, which is in the rural district of Colasay.  This community is known for its green pastures.  The residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.  This area is located in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  

Imer has a store where he offers basic necessity products such as rice, oil, sugar, milk, and other items.  He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PEN so that he can buy groceries to restock his business.  This will enable him to offer products to his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for restocking his store.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour and sugar that will help her make more money to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour and sugar that will help her make more money to invest back into her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in West Point,  is 42 years old and is married.  Her husband is a businessman and they have nine children between 7 and 20 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For three years she has been operating a restaurant in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and learned it from her mother. She like her business because she makes a good profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, fish, coal, etc. for her business. Her goal is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, fish, coal, etc. for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo.  She has four years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the holiday of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.  Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Merland

texts.en: Merland was born in 1993. She is married and a mother of 3. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband is a mechanic. Merland has been trying her best to support her husband in covering their children's needs by running her project of clothing sales. She started it 2 years ago and found it profitable. Now she would like to raise the quantity of her products to raise her sales, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Moonda

texts.en: Moonda is a 58-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she felt it obligatory to provide the basic necessities of life to her family. So she started a business selling bed sheets to the people of her community to earn a good amount of money. Moonda has become famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality bed sheets and covers in different colors and designs. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality bed sheets and covers in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Luchadoras De Los Chajones Group

texts.es:
DÚO LUCHADORAS DE LOS CHAJONES
Doña Oralia de los Ángeles, es casada tiene 24 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo, ella esta solicitando este crédito para ampliar su negocio, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, verduras y frutas y útiles escolares, y por la temporada escolar, ella quiere invertir ya que ahora comienzan a estudiar los niños y por su sector es la única tienda que vende útiles escolares, quiere comprar más productos para su tienda para que cuando los niños pasen por su tienda compren,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el creditos solicitado ya que en los creditos anteriores ella a pagado bien y no callo en mora.
texts.en:
"Luchadoras de Los Chajones" Group

Doña Oralia de Los Ángeles is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business.  Oralia sells everyday consumer products, vegetables, fruits, and school supplies for the school year.  She wants to invest now because her children are starting school.  In her area, she has the only store that sells school supplies.  

Oralia wants to buy more products for when the children come to her store.  This will enable her to wait on them.  The loans she has requested have been a great help and she has done a good job of repaying them without falling behind.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and food products to sell.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is a 53-year-old married woman and has been selling milk for many years. 

She has 2 buffalos and sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter which she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead her decent life. She is the mother of three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

This is her 4th year with Kashf Foundation.  She is happily running a sustainable business.  Currently, she has requested for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
Alma es soltera, vive sus mis padres, es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de empresa, también trabaja como un medio de poder tener lo que necesita para poder estudiar.
Comenta que su meta es recibirse dentro de 2 años y trabajar en una empresa como administradora o  administrar su propia empresa. Además dice que le inspira su familia porque son personas sacrificadas y que siempre le dan lo mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad y así seguir con sus estudios, luchando por mejorar día a día
texts.en:
Alma is single, lives with her parents, and is a student studying business administration.  She also works so as to be able to have what she needs to be able to study.

She says that her goal is to graduate within 2 years and then work for a company in administration or run her own business.  In addition, she says that her family inspires her because they sacrifice much for their family and and have always given her the best they can.

She is asking for this loan so as to use it to pay for her college bills.  In this way, she will continue with her studies and strive to get better every day.

loans.use: pay her college bills.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
El señor Hermes tiene 31 años, está en pareja con Carolina con quien tiene una hija pequeña, ambos se esfuerzan día a día para tener su casa propia y brindarle lo mejor a su única hija y que el día de mañana sea una persona de bien.
Hermes es  dueño de un camión tipo trasganado, es decir que trasporta ganado, con el que realiza servicio de fletes por todo el país, cuenta con la habilitación correspondiente y también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Pide este crédito para poder arreglar su camión, el cual es su mayor fuente de ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Hermes is 31 years old, he is married to Carolina, and they have a small daughter. They work hard each day so that they can have their own house and to provide the best for their only daughter, with the goal that one day she will be a good person.

Hermes is the owner of a 12-wheeler truck and he transports cattle. He provides fleet services across the country.  He also works in the purchase and sale of cattle.

He is seeking a loan in order to repair his truck, which is his main source of income, so that he can continue helping his family.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Lucia Alexandra

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 25 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 6 y 5 año en el Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Lucia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Comercial López y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es comprarse un carro.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Lucia is 25 years old and in a common-law relationship.  She lives with her husband and children (ages 6 and 5) in the canton of Mocache in Los Ríos Province.  

The Communal Bank named "Juntos Triunfaremos" (We Triumph Together) is located in the neighborhood of Jhon F. Kennedy 2, which is located in the canton of Mocache near Ventanas.  The members are farm laborers and livestock breeders.  

Lucia is a farmer has been growing corn and rice for a few years.  She buys her products in Ventanas at the López commercial district.  Lucia also sells at a market in the same area.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for her corn and rice crops.  Her family's financial situation will improve as a result of the loan.  Her dream is to buy a car.  

In her free time, she enjoys working in the fields.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.en:
Luis Gabriel (20 years old) and Juana (24 years old) are the parents of 2 children - Juan who is 10 years old and Gabriela who is 9 months old.  Currently, Luis and his family live in the house of Luis’ mother alongside Luis’ brothers.  The house only has 2 rooms, a kitchen and an outdoor latrine.  It is overcrowded. 

They are inhabitants of the municipality of Urique in the northern state of Chihuahua in Mexico, famous because of the Copper Canyon.  The municipality has 2,300 inhabitants, some of whom are Tarahumara Indians, who still live their own culture and speak their own language.

Luis and Juana want to use this loan to build their own home.  They see it as an opportunity they have to offer their children an inheritance - a home where they can feel comfortable, where they can move from the kitchen to the room with all the freedom their own house can give them, improving their quality of life.

Luis Gabriel is a young father and is known as responsible and hard working.  He is a very respectful and sociable young man without vices and he has a very good sense of humor.  Luis Gabriel is a hotel employee and is also a waiter in a community 9km away, where Juana also works as a cook.  Juana is a committed mother and wife - hard working, with a very good temperament. 

At the moment they are completely dedicated to their work.  Together they earn USD 307 a month, and with this money they pay for food, education, health, and clothing.  They also try to save money for the future - especially for housing because they want to own a home.  Luis Gabriel says that they saw a possibility with Habitat to make their dreams come true.  They have completed all the program requirements.  In addition, they are a very active and participative family in all the activities of the community. 

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe and affordable place to live.  Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system.  The families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing, and financial education so they can develop and strengthen their capacities.  Habitat for Humanity has worked in Mexico since 1989 and has served more than 7,000 families just in the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Mario Roberto

texts.es: Mario, tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre y un hermano en el municipio de puerto, Cortes. El trabajo varios años en una maquila y cuando quedo sin empleo decidió con su madre poner un negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, pan, churros, pastas, productos de limpieza, pollos, etc. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, azúcar, harina, manteca, huevos, condimentos pan, etc.  Para surtir y vender en esta temporada buena. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old, is single, and lives with her mother and brother in the city of Puerto Cortes.  He worked in a factory for many years but when he found himself out of work, he decided with his mother to start a grocery store where he sells basic grains, meat, snacks, bread, churros, pasta, cleaning products, chicken, etc.

He is asking for a second loan for 20,000 lempiras to use to buy basic grains, meat, soft drinks, sugar, flour, lard, eggs, condiments, bread, etc.  In this way, he will be able to stock up his store and sell his goods during this busy season.  His goals include helping his business grow and helping his family.

loans.use: buy basic grains, meat, soft drinks, sugar, flour, lard, eggs, condiments, bread, etc.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20-year-old woman who lives in a region of Jordan called Mafraq with her husband and only daughter. She is a 3rd year student majoring in education. 

Wisam is planning to get her degree in order to find a suitable job teaching that will allow her to help her husband financially, as he is currently facing financial crisis. Because of this, he us unable to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Nishoo

texts.en:
Nishoo is 39 years old, married and has two children. She has been knitting sweaters, caps and shawls for many years. She works hard on her craft every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. 

Nishoo is requesting her 7th loan from Kashf Foundation for Rs. 55,000, which she will use to purchase skeins of wool and thread in different colors along with the packs of needles. With the loan, she hopes to get increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase skeins of wool and thread in different colors along with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married  woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  She runs a sari-sari (general) store.  She sells various items like biscuits, chips, sugar, noodles and toiletries. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory of noodles, soap, canned goods, soda, etc.  This will help her maintain the inventory of her store and cater her customers' needs.

In the future, Angela hopes to expand her business and save to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of noodles, soap, canned goods, soda, etc.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  For 12 years, Shamim has been running business selling milk. 

She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a time when her husband was the only bread earner.  Over time, her sales increased and also her income.  This has all happened due to her courage and determination.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies.  She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Francis Bladimir

texts.es:
Francis es un hombre de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6to grado académico, está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos; dos de los 4 hijos van a la escuela los cuatros viven con él.

Francis  trabaja como agente de seguridad, en una empresa de la ciudad, este trabajo lo tiene desde hace 4 años;  inicio el trabajo gracias a la orientación de un amigo que lo llevo a que consiguiera el empleo. Pero también se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo de la agricultura lo hace desde que era un niño se lo enseño el papá; ya que en la vida le iba a servir en el trabajo de la agricultura, le ayuda la esposa, en el puesto de trabajo de seguridad lo hace en turnos de 24 horas, cuando descansa trabaja en la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitado a fundación campo, es para pagar unas deudas que tiene con otras personas de la comunidad, ya que él hace dos meses sufrió una enfermedad que decidieron operarlo y fue así que se enfermó. El préstamo vendrá a mejorar su situación, ya que con la institución puedo ir abonando mensualmente las cuotas y con las personas no pero eso ayudara mucho porque tiene más tiempo para pagar.

Los sueños para su futuro, es seguir trabajando con la agricultura y así poder tener siempre el sostén de la familia y que los alimentos no falten y así también con las ganancias y de su trabajo como seguridad poder enviar a estudiar a sus  hijos y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Francis is a man of 32. He went to school through sixth grade. He is married, and his wife does the domestic work. Two of their four children go to school, and all four live with them.

Francis works as a security officer at a business in the city. He has had this work for four years. He began this work thanks to the guidance of a friend who took him to get the job. But he also works in agriculture. He has done this agricultural work since he was a boy. His father taught him, since the agricultural work would be useful to him in life. His wife helps him. In his security job he works in 24-hour shifts, so when he is off, he does agricultural work.

The loan that he is applying for at Fundación Campo is to pay off some debts that he has with other people in the community, since two months ago he suffered an illness for which they decided to operate on him, and this was how he became sick. The loan will improve his situation, since with the institution he can make monthly payments but he can't with the individuals, and this will help him a lot because he has more time to pay.

His dreams for his future are to continue working in agriculture and thus always be able to sustain his family, since they won't lack for food, and with his earnings from his work as a security officer to be able to send his children to school and raise them.

loans.use: to pay some debts that he has to other people in the community.

loans.name: Marta Adilia

texts.es:
Marta Adilia habita en la comarca La Palma ubicada a 10 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce el cual es un lugar muy agradable que lo caracteriza porque a orillas de la carretera pasa un enorme y caudaloso río que sus habitantes lo utilizan para lavar ropa y bañarse, aguar el ganado.
Marta Adilia es una profesora con más de veinte años de experiencia, madre soltera de una hija a su cargo donde agradece a Dios por tener este trabajo digno que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hija y ayudar a su madre.
En este momento está solicitan la ayuda a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito para la compra de medicamentos y realización de exámenes de su mamá con el fin de mejorar su salud, ya que por la distancia y las condiciones en las que habitan alejado de la ciudad se les hace muy difícil estar viajando sobre todo por la edad de su mamá y lo costoso del medicamento.
Espera que estas personas de buen corazón la apoyen en este momento que tanto lo necesita donde lea agradecerá por toda su vida.
texts.en:
Marta Adila lives in the region of La Palma located 10 kilometres from the town of El Sauce, which is a very nice place characterised by the edge of the highway passing a great river that residents use for washing clothes, bathing and watering down livestock.
Marta Adilia is a teacher with over twenty years experience and mother to a daughter who she looks after. She is grateful for having this job that allows her to raise her daughter and help her mother.
She is currently asking for help from Kiva lenders through the field partner Ceprodel to finance a loan helping her buy medicines and pay for medical check-ups for her mother in order to improve her health. However, the distance (the fact that they live out of town) and their living circumstances mean that it is difficult to travel, particularly due to the age of her mother and the expense of her medicine.
She hopes that good-hearted people will provide the necessary help in her moment of great need. She will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical check-ups for her mother

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 37-years-old and he lives in Yerevan. Garik is married and he has two school-aged sons and both of them are sportsmen. Garik has higher education and he graduated the Agricultural Academy.  His specialty is as a builder and architect. It is already eight years that Garik is running his own business. He has a workshop and he, with the help of his father and wife, produces cutlets, kebabs, pelmeni (a Russian national dish made of meat and dough) and khinkali (a Georgian national dish also made of meat and dough and with some spices). All these products Garik distributes to different food markets, supermarkets and he says that he also has orders from restaurants. The main product that he needs is meat that he buys from local butchers or he drives to nearby villages and brings the meat from there.

Garik says that his business is thriving and his orders have increased, so he already wants to hire several workers and a cook, so he has asked a loan of 3000 US  dollars in order to enlarge his workshop so he work faster and more productively.

loans.use: to enlarge his workshop so he can work faster and more productively.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Because Dalal is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Dalal was born in 1981. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with her husband who is running a dry cleaning business. Her husband got his experience from prior work at another dry cleaner. Then he decided to be a partner with his friend and opened their own dry cleaning store. 

Now, his friend wants to sell his share of the business and Dalal’s husband wants to buy it in order to be the only owner, thus earning more profit.  However, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy out his partner and own the entire dry cleaning business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 26 years old and his wife, Petrona, is 24 years old.  They have 3 girls: María who is 7 years old, Claudia who is 5, and Juana, the youngest one, who is 3 years old.  They live in a two-room house made of wood with an earth floor in Pozo, which has 1262 inhabitants.  According to some statistics, it has 215 households and few speak Spanish well.  82% don't have any income. 

Antonio and Petrona want this loan to improve their life conditions, as they know the importance of having a safe place where they can improve their life situation.  Their aspirations are pretty much to have a safe place to live with their children, and to be able to give them an education which they themselves didn't have.
 This is a young couple and during the workshops and interviews, they can be identified as people with a lot of energy and enthusiasm to overcome.  According with the culture, they have grown their family, as they believe that with more children, they will have more workers and income, and consequently a better life.  

Most of the community works in farming, as there aren't jobs, and they survive with the harvest.  There is little income and when it's not harvest season, the father must work elsewhere and leave the family for several months, often searching for jobs as a baker's assistant or farmhand.  Almost everyone in the community are coffee producers, however the prices they get are very low because of the “coyotes” (who are the intermediaries, and market the coffee for the producers but in the end keep the majority of profits).

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe, and affordable place to live.  Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system.  The families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing, and financial education in order to develop and strengthen their capacities.  Habitat for Humanity has been working in Mexico since 1989 and has served more than 7,000 families just in the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Mayra Lorena

texts.es:
Mayra es una persona de 39 años de edad. Quien realizo sus estudios de educación básica en el centro escolar del mismo lugar, debido a la falta de recursos económicos, que en aquella época su familia cruzaba, no pudo continuar con sus estudios de educación media, motivo por el cual ella se dedico a trabajar en la venta de tortillas de maíz con una vecina. La señora Mayra  proviene de una familia trabajadora, la cual le inculco buenos principios morales  y con mucho esfuerzo le han ayudado a salir adelante. La señora Mayra tiene una familia formada por sus dos hijos, para los cuales trabaja con mucho sacrificio para darles lo mejor y lo necesario; ellos se encuentran cursando educación básica en el centro escolar,   los cuales pretende ayudar a salir adelante con sus estudios, hasta que puedan graduarse como unos profesionales.

La señora Mayra actualmente tiene su propio negocio  y se dedica a la venta de tortillas y en el cual ya tiene una experiencia de mas de 15 años, negocio que prendió de la vecina con  la cual trabajo por mas de 8 años. Ahora ella continua, trabajando con ayuda de su hermana menor ella tiene el negocio frente a la casa de sus padres, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado.  

El  préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maíz y para poner un pequeño negocio de luces pirotécnicos, por encontrarnos en época de fin de año. De esta manera aumentara sus ganancias, he ira buscando otra fuente de ingresos, que vendrá a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

 Ella planea en un futuro tener un negocio mas grande y surtido el cual le generara mas ganancias y las cuales le servirán, para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y sacar adelanta a su hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra is 39 years old.  She got an elementary school education in the school in her town.  Because her family lacked resources when she was young, she was not able to continue to middle school.  For this reason she started working, selling corn tortillas with a neighbor.  Mayra comes from a hardworking family that instilled in her good moral principles, and with a lot of effort, they have helped her to get ahead.  

Mayra formed a family that includes two children, for whom she works with a lot of sacrifice so that she can give them the best and provide for their needs.  Her children are in the local elementary school.  She plans to help them advance in their studies until they can graduate from college and become professionals.  

Mayra now has her own business selling tortillas.  She has 15 years of experience in this line of work.  She learned the business from her neighbor, with whom she worked for 8 years.  Now she is continuing to work with the help of her younger sister.  Her business is set up in front of her parents' house.  She works Mondays through Saturdays.  

Mayra is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy corn and to start up a small fireworks business, as we are now near the end of the year.  In this way she will increase her earnings, as she's been looking to find another source of income that will bring a better quality of life to her family.  In the future, she plans to have a bigger business that is well-stocked and will generate more earnings.  This would allow her to satisfy her family's basic needs and  help her children to make progress in life.

loans.use: to buy corn and to start a small fireworks business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is grateful for her previous Kiva loan which improved her standard of living.  She still operates a vegetable stall.

Rose wants to buy a water tank that she will use to sell water to her customers.  She is requesting for a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase a water tank, onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank, onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale .

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten was born in 1974. She is a married woman living in region of Jordan called Zarqa.  She lives with her husband, who works in construction, and her 2 children.  

One of her sons is a student at the university, majoring in engineering.  He is in his 1st year which is the beginning of his studies.  Her son is planning to work as an engineer after graduation to help his family financially because of the financial crisis Faten and her husband are facing.  They are not able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Faten has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Caminando Juntos” conformada por 08 socias emprendedoras. Martha de 51 años de edad es  casada y tiene 07 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Martha junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de mazamorras, la cual los ofrece en un mercado concurrente y lleva más de 07 años en dicha actividad. Con el fruto de su  esfuerzo pudo comprarse una mototaxi y  la brinda como servicio de transporte  generándole  un ingreso extra  para su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinó para la compra de insumos como azúcar, canela, pasas y vasos. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Caminando Juntos” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Martha es la cuarta del lado izquierdo, lleva un sombrero y viste polo color morado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Camindando Juntos" (Walking Together) consists of eight enterprising members.  

Martha is 51 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is still a dependent.  She and her husband sell "mazamorra" (corn pudding) that they offer at a variety market.  They have been in this business for more than seven years.  With the fruit of their efforts, they were able to buy a motorcycle taxi for providing transportation services as an extra source of household income.  Her latest loan will be used to buy supplies such as sugar, cinnamon, raisins, and cups.  Continuing to work in a positive manner is her greatest wish.  

The group "Camindando Juntos" appreciates the Kiva lenders for the help they have provided.  Martha is fourth from the left, wearing a hat and a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cinnamon, raisins, and cups.

loans.name: Ronal Noel

texts.es:
El señor  Ronal es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su negocio el cual es una Pulpería.
Don Ronal tiene su negocio desde hace más de 15  años, el cual funciona en su casa de habitación en la aldea donde vive.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de productos como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aguas, refrescos, café, pan, leche, huevo, etc. y así seguir realizando su negocio.
Don Ronal con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho, ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Don Ronal espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para  que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del  2013
texts.en:
Ronal is a hardworking, humble and responsible person who lives in an area south of Honduras with his family. His business is a grocery store and he sells basic commodities. Ronal has had his business for over 15 years, which operates from his home in the village where he lives. He requires a loan in order to buy a variety of products such as sugar, rice, beans, water, soft drinks, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, etc. and thereby continue doing business.
With this loan, Ronal hopes that his sales will increase and that this will help a great deal, since he he cannot currently provide the products that his customers demand and fulfill orders. Through this he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of life a little, with an increase in household income.
Ronal hopes soon to grow his business and with this be able to continue supporting his family so that they may have more opportunities in life.

Cholutecta, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, water, soft drinks, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es:
Ana de 51 años de edad, es una madre soltera de de un hijo. Ella solo tiene un grado de estudio de bachiller, el cual no le ha sido una dificultad, para  salir a delante con su familia. Su esposo falleció, hace un par de años por enfermedad natural, dejando a su único hijo en manos de su madre, y que ha sido quien ha luchado para salir adelante con sus estudios y otros gastos hoy en día. Ana  vive solo con su hijo quien le ayuda en muchas cosas desde la casa hasta los trabajos de campo. A pesar que es una familia muy pequeña, tratan de trabajar juntos y salir adelante.

Ana se dedica a la venta de antojitos como pasteles, yuca frita, tostada de plátano y el más fuerte es la venta de panes rellenos con pollo, esa es la actividad que el cliente realiza desde hace 10 años en el centro del municipio. El negocio lo inicio al ver la necesidad de generar ingresos, para poder darle el estudio a su hijo y poder salir adelante con los gastos de la casa. A parte de esto el cliente hoy tiene una ayuda por parte de su hijo quien trabaja en la agricultura y de jornal donde tienes sus ingresos y le ayuda a su madre, con los gastos de la casa, la venta la hace toda la semana solo 2 días descansa y de su casa camina para llegar hasta donde instala su venta y su hijo le ayuda con la producción de granos básicos para la elaboración de algunos antojitos, y su hora de venta es de las 2 pm hasta las 6 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para invertir en la compra de los productos que necesita, para elaborar los antojitos, como plátano, yuca y el pollo que necesita para los panes esto porque al comprar las cosas por mayor, obtiene un mejor precio y realmente con el préstamo espera que su negocio aumente más, en la época navideña.

Ella, piensa seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios,  le de fuerza y así ayudar a su único hijo que tiene el deseo de seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria, y espera poder estar presente cuando ese día llegue y ver a su hijo que podrá tener mejores condiciones en la vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 51, is a single mother who has one child.  She only completed one year of high school, which was not a difficulty for her, because she needed to help her family to get ahead.  Her husband died after suffering for 2 years from natural causes, leaving her with her only child.  It has been for him that she has struggled, so that she could provide for him and so that he could get an education.  

Ana lives alone with her son, who helps her with many things, from household tasks to working in the fields.  In spite of being a very small family, they try to work together so that they can get ahead.  

Ana has a business selling snacks such as cakes, fried cassava, banana tostadas, and her main product, which is bread filled with chicken.  She's had this business for 10 years, and she sells in the center of her town.  She started this business seeing a need to generate income so that she could give her son an education and cover the household expenses. 

In addition to this, she now has help from her son, who works in agriculture and as a day worker where he gets an income so that he can help his mother with the household expenses.  Ana sells all week with only 2 days of rest.  She walks from her house to the place where she has set up a stall, and her son helps her with the production of staple grains that she uses to make some of her snacks.  She sells from 2pm until 6pm.  

Ana is requesting a loan to buy the products that she needs to make her snacks, such as bananas, cassava, and the chicken she needs for her stuffed bread.  She will buy these products at wholesale to get a better price.  She hopes that with this loan her business will grow during the Christmas season.  

Ana plans to continue to work as long as God gives her the strength, so that she can help her only child, who hopes to continue to study for a university degree.  She hopes to be present when this day arrives, and to see her son be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy food products to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Sagrada Familia forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Marisel es modista, y comenta que con su trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, todo por poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día y no tener que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo y cumpliendo con los varios pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group called "Sagrada Familia" (Holy Family) is part of the program to eliminate poverty, and each member is doing the survey about eliminating poverty in order to be able to understand each one' s situation and work to overcome their poverty indicators.

Marisel is a dressmaker. She comments that with her work and effort she is making progress, all to be able to give her family what they need for day-to-day life and so that they won't have to experience needs like those that she had to experience. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabrics and threads, since this will allow her to continue with her work and fulfill the various orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аиде 28 лет, не замужем, проживает вместе с родителями. У Аиды - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аида занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аиды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 овцы. Дополнительно Аида занимается куплей-продажей овощей. Закупает на оптовом рынке и реализует розничным покупателям. Аида очень старательная, так как родители долгое время занимались животноводтством, то и Аиде они привили любовь к труду и животным. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аида обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на открытие небольшого овощного павильона.
texts.en: Aida is 28 years old, single and lives with her parents. Aida has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Aida is involved in animal husbandry, having started 9 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aida's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 3 sheep. She is additionally involved in reselling vegetables.  She sells them at a wholesale market and resells to retail customers.  Aida is very diligent because her parents were involved in animal husbandry for a long time and they got Aida to love hard work and animals.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Aida requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Aida plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to open a small pavilion for selling vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Eva Adalgisa

texts.es:
La señora Eva de 27 años  de edad es soltera,  vive con sus  dos hermanos y su madre en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace un año y medio  al negocio de venta de joyería, sus clientes son sus amigas y personas que le conocen.
Doña Eva es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Doña Eva está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pulseras, anillos, cremas, perfumes, lociones, carteras, etc.  con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, es un cliente nuevo que su sueño es tener un buen record de pago para seguir trabajando con Prisma y también desea este año terminar de construir un cuarto para vivir ella y su pareja.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Eva, 27, is single and lives with her two siblings and her mother in her home.  For a year and a half, she's had a business selling jewelry.  Her customers are her friends and people she knows.

Eva is a hardworking person who has a desire to get ahead.  She lives in the town of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  She sells her products from place to place.

Eva is requesting a loan to buy bracelets, rings, creams, perfumes, lotions, handbags, etc.  With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income and provide for her family.  She is a new client of Prisma Honduras, and her dream is to establish a good credit record so that she can continue to work with Prisma.  Also, this year she wants to finish building a room where she and her partner can live.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  December 2013.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 33 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She was unable to attend school but she says she is good at managing her business. She is single and has four children, ages 12, 14, 16 and 19. All of them are in school and live at home. For the past 15 years, Comfort has been selling candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar and flour, etc. from a small shop in the market. She has lots of customers and makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar and flour, etc. for her business. Comfort hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar and flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en: Basima was born in 1959. She is lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat with her husband who is a taxi driver, and four sons and daughters. Basima has been sewing clothes for 10 years. She started her project with a small amount of sewing materials. Then she started expanding it gradually. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of fabric and silk in order to raise her productivity and income, which will let her be a good financial support to her family. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and silk for her business

loans.name: Sadguru Group

texts.en:
Syamala, about 45 years old, is the group leader of a four-member group in Kotapeta village situated in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Her family includes four members: her husband, one daughter, about 20 years old, and two sons, about 22 and 18 years old, respectively. The member standing on the extreme left with a raised hand is Syamala. At present, she is making and selling leaf plates. Her daughter helps in making the plates. Syamala is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts.

Syamala’s husband is doing a seasonal business. At present, her family income is Rs 4,500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan.  With the loan, she will purchase a big stock of leaves for stitching and selling.

She has a dream of being a wholesaler of leaf plates in her locality.

The other three members of the group are named Usha, Puspa and Amala. All of them are doing tailoring work and all of them want a loan to purchase tailoring machines and Pico machines.

loans.use: to purchase more leaves for making plates

loans.name: Nurmuhamad

texts.ru:
Нурмухамаду 27 лет. Он родом из села района Кубадиён. Нурмухамад женат и живет с женой у родителей. У них пока детей нет. 
Нурмухамад вместе с отцом, матерью и женой занимается животноводством. Они выращивают молодых бычков, и по прошествии месяца продают по прибыльной цене. Нурмухамад занимается этим бизнесом более 3 лет. В настоящее время с наступлением зимы стоимость скота на рынке немного подешевело. Пользуясь этим случаем Нурмухамад хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. Но для осуществления цели ему не хватает собственных средств и поэтому недостающую сумму он просит в кредит. Нурмухамад ждет финансовой поддержки. Благодаря кредиту он сможет увеличить бюджет семьи.
texts.en:
Nurmuhamad is 27 years old.  He comes from a village located in the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  He is married and lives with his wife and parents.  He doesn't have any children yet.

Nurmuhamad is involved in animal husbandry, an activity he practices with his father, mother and wife.  Together, they raise young bulls, which they resell after a month at a profitable price.  Nurmuhamad has worked in this field for more than three years.   In winter, livestock prices are significantly lower at the cattle market, and  Nurmuhamad wants to use this opportunity to increase the cattle headcount on his farm.  However, he doesn't have enough money to achieve his goals and this is why he is taking a loan.  He is awaiting financial support.  This loan will allow him to increase his family's budget.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls to increase his cattle headcount.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.  Vive junto a su esposo y es madre de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Marina se dedica a la venta de comidas, todas las mañanas  instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y oferta todas sus comidas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos, y la recomiendan a otros personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Se inició hace más de 08 años con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, verduras, carnes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marina, 38 years old, is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives with her husband and her two children in her own house. 

Marina works selling food—every morning she sets up her table in front of her parents’ house to sell all the meals that she has prepared, along with soft drinks. She provides very friendly service to her customers, most of whom are her neighbors—and they recommend her to other people who become her regular customers over time. 

She started her business over ten years ago with a private loan—buying  and selling in small quantities and expanding along with the demand for her food. So far, she has been working alone. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she feels sure that she will make progress with her business; and she promises to be punctual with her payments.

She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, and similar items.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, and similar items.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fiza

texts.en: Ghulam Fiza is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Ten years ago, she began boutique work in her house. She stitches clothes after doing embroidery for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. By now, she has become popular in her community and has attained a good number of customers. Her daughter also assists her in completing orders for her customers. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 55,000. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of threads along with the packs of beads, zippers and needles. This will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her eighth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy threads, beads, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Hari Shankar Group

texts.en:
Rohini, about 52 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Muniguda in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She has three sons about 26, 24 and 18 years old. The member sitting second from right with a raised hand is Rohini.
 
Rohini has been managing a ready-made clothing shop in her locality for the last 10 years.  In 2009, Rohini and three members of her village formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses. This is their third loan.
  
At the time she took her first loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her daily needs. Out of her small income, she is maintaining her family in a low profile. Now, she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her shop significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs 6,000. She wants to take another loan to purchase a big stock of ready-made items like shirts, trousers, under garments etc.  She has a dream of constructing a well and extending her house.

The other three members of the group are named Damayanti, Subashini and Ananta. They want a loan for a fancy shop, a ready made shop and a fish business, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a big stock of ready-made garments

loans.name: Frances S.

texts.en: Frances S. is a 24-year-old woman who lives with her three children in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She did not attend school and she is single. Her children's ages are 6, 9 and 11, and they are in school. For the past five years, she has been selling slippers and teddy bears from a table in the local market. Sometimes business goes slowly, but most of the time she realizes a profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and teddy bears to increase her sales. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and teddy bears to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with six children, and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of her daughter in law. She has a business of a food stall selling tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, onions and sweet potatoes. She has been in this business for 10 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days per week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to open and own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, boxes of tomatoes, onions and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is an 18-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her family. She is studying for her Diploma, majoring in Accounting. She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her study journey. Eman is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start her work life in order to help her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which prevents them from paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Aida Yasenia

texts.es: Aida de 32 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Aida trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad desde hace tres años. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios para enladrillar  el piso, repellar y pintar las paredes. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y pintura.
texts.en: Aida is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her children who are 16 and 14. Her children are studying in local public school. She’s been working at a business close to her town for three years. She’d like to improve her living conditions, and so she’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy necessary materials to tile the floor and plaster and paint the walls. With this money she’ll buy cement, sand, tiles, and paint.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, tiles, and paint to tile the floor and to plaster and paint the walls in her house.

loans.name: Maria Gumercinda

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. María es una mujer admirable quien se gana la vida trabajando como jornalera lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y apoyar con los gastos diarios. María habita en condiciones muy humildes por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado desea comprar: polines y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old and has lived in her own home with her family for some time. Maria is a lovely woman who earns her living as a day laborer which allows her to support her household and afford daily expenses. Maria’s living conditions are very humble which is why she’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to finance repairing her roof. She’ll use the money to buy support beams and galvanized metal sheets.

loans.use: to buy support beams and galvanized metal sheets to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas es un grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Itá, el cual está integrado por 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que están luchando por salir adelante. Están en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Delia, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que cada día trabaja por  mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella se ha hecho de una clientela bien formada que compra de ella sus productos, y es así que está pudiendo crecer. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más cosméticos, y así seguir con sus ventas y consiguiendo más clientes para poder expandirse.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is a group from the city of Ita. It is made up for 18 hardworking women who work very hard to get ahead. They are in their first loan cycle. 

One person who stands out is Delia. She sells cosmetics. She’s a hardworking woman who works every day to improve her family’s quality of life. She has a solid client base who buy their cosmetics from her which is how she’s been able to expand. She’s asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics and continue with her sales and building her client base so that she’s able to further expand.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es: El señor marcos trabaja de sol a sol en un mercado con su negocio de venta ambulante de lentes, relojes entre otros,  para mantener a su familia, que la conforman su esposa y sus dos hijitos que están en edad escolar, por los que desea finalicen una carrera profesional, para que tengan un buen futuro. Don Marcos solicita el crédito para comprar lentes, relojes, para mantener su inventario y continuar vendiendo junto a su esposa quien también le ayuda a  vender.
texts.en:
Marcos works every day in a market where he sells glasses, watches, and other things as a street vendor so as to support his family.  He is married and has two young children that are of school age.  He hopes to allow them to have professional careers so that they can have good futures.

Marcos is asking for a loan to buy glasses and watches so he can keep his wares stocked and continue to sell along with his wife (who helps him in his sales).

loans.use: buy glasses and watches.

loans.name: Alman

texts.en: Alman is 41-years-old.  He lives in the Fuzuli region near the war zone with his family. The members of his family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, for over the past 20 years.  Alman is married and has two children.  One of the children is a 15-year-old boy, he goes to the eighth grade class in school, another child is 13-years-old and she goes to the sixth grade class.  His wife is a housewife, she helps Alman with his work.  Alman has been in the animal breeding business and loves his job.  He sells milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) which are made by Alman and his wife.  Now Alman wants to buy more cows. Therefore, he needs a loan amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).  Alman is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for this loan. In the future, as a result of the increase in his business he wants to build a new stall for his cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 26 years old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one daughter in a small humble house in the city. Alaa works on transfering goods for the traders using his old rickshaw. It is a good business but its income is not stable. Alaa would like to improve his business. 

Alaa  took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer the goods for the local traders. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to do his work easily using his new rickshaw. 
Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer the goods for the local traders.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб женатый мужчина из города Турсунзаде. Ему 28 лет. Сухроб около 8 лет работает в сфере торговли. Он занимается продажей зимней обуви на местном рынке. Сухроб закупает товар оптом и продает рознично. В работе Сухробу помогает его семья. Сухроб выходит на работу в любую погоду и дня недели, ведь теперь, когда зимний сезон его товар более востребованный. Сухроб хочет привести больше товара и увеличить количество, качество и различность товара, чтобы увеличить продажу. Из-за того что у него мало средств, он вынужден взять кредит на привозку и куплю товара он берет кредит с надеждой на активную продажу.
texts.en: Suhrob is a married man from the city of Tursunzoda. He is 28 years old.  He has been working as a retailer for almost eight years, selling winter shoes at the local market.  He buys shoes in bulk quantities and resells on a retail basis.  His family helps him to run the business.  He works in any weather and any day of the week because in winter his merchandise is in high demand.  He wants to bring in more shoes and increase the quantity, quality and variety of his merchandise in order to increase his sales.  Because he has very little money, he is forced to take a loan to bring in more merchandise for resale.  He is taking this loan hoping for a high sale volume.

loans.use: to buy winter shoes in order to increase his sales.

loans.name: Daif Allah

texts.en:
Daif Allah is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah city.  He lives with his family in a small humble house in the city.  Daif is a construction worker. It is a good business but the income is not stable. Daif would like to improve his business. 

Daif took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer construction material for his work.  By taking this loan, Daif will be able to do his work easily using his rickshaw. 

Daif appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer construction material for his work

loans.name: Duvan

texts.es:
El es duvan, le gusta mucho la carrera de mecánica y el a nivel profesional  en el área  de la mecánica  automotriz ,proyecta el avance  a  abrir grandes  puertas a un futuro,  con grandes  expectativas laborales, ya que a nivel  profesional  campo alto  da buenas bases de conocimientos  que se ven reflejados en las practicas.
 En cuanto  a lo personal,  la carrera de mecánica ,es una profesión  que abre puertas  a otros campos  laborales  y con esta base  para crecer  cada día más como profesionales   y tener una calidad  de vida satisfactoria  y con muchos éxitos,  cada vez aumentaran a medida que se va creciendo como profesional  se beneficia la vida personal  ya que en una familia  esta carrera da un beneficio muy importante  y de gran valor como lo es una estabilidad económica capaz de soportar  un hogar  con una gran experiencia en este campo da grandes recompensas y  llegar  a suplir cualquier necesidad. 
Por lo cual quiere continuar con esta carrera y en este momento por recursos económicos  no pueda continuar,  por este motivo quisiera pedirle a  KIVA  que le colabore con el  convenio para continuar con la carrera, no será un apoyo perdido ya que lo verán reflejado en las notas y el buen comportamiento  en la institución.
texts.en:
This is Duvan.  He greatly enjoys the mechanics program and becoming a professional in the area of automotive repair.  This path will open doors in the future.  With expectations of getting good jobs, the professional programs at CampoAlto provide a good base of knowledge that is reflected in the practicums.  

In terms of a career, the mechanics program can open doors in other fields since it provides a base for growing each day like other professionals.  It can also lead to a satisfactory quality of life and great success.  By growing as professionals each day, these individuals will also experience benefits in their personal lives and with their families.  Therefore this program provides a very important benefit and is a great value in terms of providing financial stability for supporting a household.  Having good experience in this field will also lead to generous compensation for meeting any need.  

For this reason, Duvan wants to continue his program since he is not able at the moment because of financial reasons.  He is requesting assistance from Kiva so that he can continue in the program.  This support will not be lost, as reflected in his grades and his good performance at CampoAlto.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 24-years-old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family that consists of five siblings and his parents.  Ashraf is studying for a Bachelor degree, majoring in Plants Production and Protection.  He is in his fourth year and one step closer to graduation.  Ashraf plans to find a job that suits his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which does not enable them to pay for his upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sombun's Group

texts.en:
Sombun, 49, is a villager from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. To cover the needs of her family, she grows rice and raises pigs as the main source of income with support from her husband.  She has been engaged in her current business for ages and she is able to earn up to 20,500 KHR per day. Sombun, a fifth time borrower with successful repayment of her past four loans, forms a group composing of two to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The past loan has helped her to sustain her business and maintain a good standard of living for her family. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income so that she can expand her pig-raising business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and insecticide for her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en: A mother in her early 40s and a resident of Kampong Cham province, Theavy is also a mother who needs to take care of five dependent children. To support this big family, she sells dessert as the main source of income. Additionally, she earns more income from her husband's occupation as a government officer. She has been involved in her business for around 20 years.  Theavy is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now taking a new loan to cover the school fees and to buy school materials for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can obtain a high degree so that her son can help the family get to a better standard of living.

loans.use: to cover school fees and to buy school materials for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 55-year-old married man. He is a farmer and mainly keeps cattle. He has been rearing cattle since 2001 in a remote area. Because the demand for milk was high and yet the supply was low, he thought he would utilize the opportunity to establish himself. With income realized from cattle rearing, he has been able to pay tuition for his children and sustain his family.

He has applied for a loan of UGX.1,500,000= so that he can buy more cattle for milk production in order to increase his profits. He also wishes to buy a motorcycle to help him in transporting milk to his customers.

His major challenge is poor transport facilities to take his milk to the market.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a lady of thirty-four years. She is married to Paul and is a mother of two children. Caroline sells second-hand clothes in Kiambaa, on the outskirts of Limuru town. She has been in this business for two years now and she earns a monthly income of 4,000 shillings.

This will be Caroline's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes to sell. She wants to educate her children and be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to sell
